access:
KEYS
We will provide 2 sets of keys for your stay. In case keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee. 

HEAT/AC
The unit has central heat/AC for your convenience with a thermostat within the unit.

WASHER/DRYER
A washer and dryer are located in a shared laundry room. Detergent is also available for your use. Note the laundry room is reserved 10am-4pm daily for our cleaning team.

CRIB
Pack-and-play crib may be rented for $5/day with 2+ day advance arrangements. Please mention this during booking, and it will be inside unit waiting for you. Note that you must supply your own sheets and blankets for the crib.
description:
Steps away from everything the trendy Wicker Park neighborhood has to offer, but tucked away on a cozy side street, this apartment can't be beat!  A perfect space for a long stay or weekend getaway!
Cozy and comfy 2 bedroom/ 1 bath unit in hip Wicker Park. Feel right at home with a full kitchen, bathroom and trendy decor. Steps from top bars, restaurants, grocery store and public transit! Perfect for a group looking to experience Chicago and have some fun!
*Expand for more info*

The unit features 10 ft ceilings and has all the comforts of home. We provide all the towels, linens, toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lotion, etc.) and coffee/tea to get you going in the morning! TV has Netflix and Amazon Prime for you to enjoy!

LIVING ROOM: 11’ x 11’ Non-Pull out Sectional couch, television, coffee table, full length mirror and reading chair are provided.

KITCHEN: Full Kitchen, Table & 4 Chairs, Paper towels, sponge, dish soap, dishwasher detergent, trash bags, coffee, sugar, creamer, cookware/dining ware, and kitchen towels are provided.  

BEDROOM 1:  Queen Bed, 7’x9’ linens, pillows, comforter/blanket are provided.  Hooks on wall to hang clothes and hangers provided. 

BEDROOM 2: 7’ X 7’Bunk Beds to sleep 2, linens, pillows, comforter/blanket are provided.  

BATHROOM:  7’ x 6’Full shower with shower stall, vanity & toilet.  Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap, trash bags, bath towels, hair dryer, and bath mat are provided..

KEYS
We will provide 2 sets of keys for your stay. In case keys are lost, there is a $15 replacement fee. 

HEAT/AC
The unit has central heat/AC for your convenience with a thermostat within the unit.

WASHER/DRYER
A washer and dryer are located in a shared laundry room. Detergent is also available for your use. Note the laundry room is reserved 10am-4pm daily for our cleaning team.

CRIB
Pack-and-play crib may be rented for $5/day with 2+ day advance arrangements. Please mention this during booking, and it will be inside unit waiting for you. Note that you must supply your own sheets and blankets for the crib.

Our team is available to answer your questions and make your stay pleasant. We are just a phone call away.

You will be a few blocks from the hottest restaurants, bars and clubs in Chicago.  Wicker Park is, simply put, one of the best neighborhoods in the city. Think Brooklyn, Austen, or Madison.  Michelin star restaurants like Schwa co-exist with some of the world's best dive bars.  The nightlife in the summertime is can't miss.

You'll be about 2 blocks from the Division Blue line, which will take you to "The Loop" in about 5 minutes.  You are a short walk to a wide range of restaurants and bars.

CHECK-IN
Check-in is self-entry at 4pm or later. Luggage storage may be available from 10:30am-3pm if arranged in advance.

PARKING
Please note that the free parking is street parking, so you will need to look for a spot once you arrive. The free street parking is first-come, first-served and distance from unit cannot be guaranteed.  For parking closest to the property, there are daily sticker parking passes available for a nominal convenience fee. 

COURTESY
Please note this unit is on a quiet residential street. We respect our neighbors and keep quiet hours from 10pm-8am. Therefore, if your group is looking for more of a party environment, please allow us 
to recommend another unit that would be better suited for that noise level.

CHECK-OUT 
Check-out is by 10am.  If you check out late or do not follow the check-out steps, you may be charged an additional cleaning fee. Luggage storage may be available from 10am-4pm if arranged in advance.

- Dirty linens can be left as is with used beds left unmade. 
- Please bag all trash and dispose in black bins behind building. Recycling goes into blue bins and should be loose or in an open brown bag.
- Please place dirty kitchen items in dishwasher and begin cycle. 
- Return all keys as you found them upon entry

description:
Show up and start living from day one in Chicago with this cozy studio Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Gold Coast home with stunning  views over the city. (#CHI129)

As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this studio property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Chicago vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. 


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this studio apartment include an on-site:
  
- In-Building Laundry
- Pet Friendly

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished rental is in the historic Gold Coast district. The area is located just north of downtown Chicago, nestled against the Lake Michigan shoreline. Considered one of the most affluent neighborhoods in the country, the Gold Coast is every upscale shopper’s dream. The retail revelry on Oak and Rush Streets includes swanky boutiques and rare, designer fashions. There are many celebrated restaurants to try, including Michelin-starred winners and classic Chicago steakhouses. Amongst the prestigious hotels and celebrated eateries, there is a trove of booming nightlife hot spots and high-energy events.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.

description:
Come stay in a quiet space with all necessary amenities in a cozy area within walking distance to metra.  Many restaurants near, safe community and close to Chicago Ridge Mall. Only 20 minutes from Midway!!

Cozy room able to comfortably sleep two with comfortable bed and bathroom right across the hall. Parking right out front is free. Its an apartment in a six flat on a dead end. Will provide coffee for breakfast.

You will access from the front of the building.  I'm the first unit upstairs on the right. There are 2 chairs on front porch to mark that it’s the front

My guests can text throughout their stay and I will gladly answer any questions.

The neighborhood is quiet and safe.  The metra is a 5 minute walk to take you down town chicago.  Its a 40 minute ride to downtown.  There are many fun activities in the area and plenty of restaurants.  The mall is close by,and Midway is only a 20 minute drive.

5 minute walk to metro.  You can park for free on premise!

I am at the location for most of the  bookings, the bedroom is private with a lockable door,i sleep in living room on sofa bed when I am  there. So the space is open,not private. With a shared bathroom,very clean! Couples or women only because it is fairly small and I am just more comfortable especially having to share the bathroom. You will see me,so hopefully that does not bother you. It is a roommate type situation,private room not whole apartment. First timers or more private type people may be uncomfortable. I am very laidback and respectful of privacy though. If you’ve been to college,piece of cake! 🙂
house_rules: Please be clean and courteous and have a great time!!

description:
My place is good for solo adventurers and business travelers.

I have a spacious bedroom and private bathroom available. There are 3 bedrooms total. The unit is very modern and great kitchens and bathrooms. It's in one of the trendiest buildings downtown.

1 of the bedrooms and 1 bathroom would be available. This unit has 3 bedrooms. The bedrooms are very spacious with large closets, floor to ceiling windows, stunning views of the city and king size beds.

GREAT LOCATION
1 block to Michigan Ave, the Magnificent
1 block to the Navy Pier
15 min walk to Millennium Park
15 min walk to the Loop
Public transportation everywhere

STUNNING VIEWS
Floor to ceiling windows, corner unit, all the exterior walls are the floor to ceiling windows
Panoramic views of the city. BREATHTAKING VIEWS!

CONDO UPGRADES
- Spectacular Views of the city
- Designer Pendant Lighting in Kitchens
- Hardwood Flooring throughout the Living Areas
- Full-size ENERGY STAR washers and dryers in all residences
- Floor-to-ceiling windows
- Expanded Ceiling Heights of 9.5 - 10.5 feet
- Kitchens with latest style Granite Countertops and GE Energy Star stainless steel appliances
- Kitchens with modern designers dark wood cabinetry
- Bathrooms with double sinks and vanities, Kohler fixtures with square sinks
- Modern tiling in the bathrooms, with deep soaking tub and stand alone showers
- 3 very large bedrooms
- 3 full size bathrooms

BUILDING AMENITIES
- Smoke-free Building
- Fully-equipped Fitness Center
- Business Center
- Media Room
- Adjacent Neighborhood Park
- Outdoor Fireplace and Terrace
- Aqua Center featuring an Oversized Spa Pool, Steam Room, Sauna and Massage Room
- Cyber Cafe' with WiFi Lounge and Fireplace
- LEED Certified Gold Building
- Indoor parking available
- 24/7 door person and security
- Nice high end boutique building, located in the heart of downtown Chicago!

GREAT LOCATION
1 block to the Magnificent Mile
1 block to the Navy Pier
15 min walk to Millennium Park
15 min walk to the Loop
Public transportation everywhere

description:
Beautiful first floor apartment in Historic Old Town. Tree-lined street,  walking distance to countless wonderful restaurants, shops and the lakefront. 

Beyond Charming, Two-bedroom unit, with one queen and one double, a full kitchen and bathroom.

This 1st floor apartment has a queen size bed in one bedroom and a double in the other bedroom. The bathroom has a bathtub and shower.

The apartment includes high speed internet (wi-fi) cable tv, private phone lines, and a complimentary washer and dryer in the building. 

Public transportation is terrific from this location; you can take the train (brown line) downtown in just 10 minutes! 

You'll be a short walk from the Lincoln Park Zoo, Chicago History Museum, world-famous Second City, great restaurants and bars like Twin Anchors (an old Sinatra hangout), Old Town Social, and Marges.

 Max occupancy per apartment is 5. Closest major intersection is North Avenue and Sedgwick Street.

We are available 24/7 if you should need anything throughout your stay.

3-4  Night Minimum depending on Season.
License # 2120297

access:
The front door  has an automatic lock keypad. You will be provided with a code prior to arrival. Please lock doors when arriving and departing. 

Security systems throughout the house for guest safety. Cameras inside and outside with and alarm system that sets after 11 pm. You must disarm if you come or leave after this time.
description:
We are located by the I-290 and a 3 minute walk to the CTA. Enjoy your stay in our home. You will have a private room with a queen sized bed. Storage space in the dressers.

55 inch smart TV Netflix in the shared Living Room. 

Plenty of free street parking available with security monitored parking. Registration number: R18000027393.

-Located on the 2nd floor.
15 steps to the top of the stairs.
Full Sized Bed comfortably sleeps two. Can provide extra towels and blankets.
-Hardwood flooring throughout house. 
-Bathroom stocked with shampoo/conditioner, towels, toilet paper, and hair dryer. 
-Kitchen has stove, microwave, fridge, and cooking utensils. All accessible to you at any time. 
-Fully functional washer and dryer with detergent and fabric softener available.
-Large back area for smoking outside.
-You will share common areas; living room, dining room, kitchen and bathroom with other guest. Your room is your private space.

The front door  has an automatic lock keypad. You will be provided with a code prior to arrival. Please lock doors when arriving and departing. 

Security systems throughout the house for guest safety. Cameras inside and outside with and alarm system that sets after 11 pm. You must disarm if you come or leave after this time.

Usually we are never home but if you need help with anything, you can message, text or call Edward.

10 minutes from Logan square
18 minute drive to Sears Tower
5 min walk to the Garfield Park Conservatory 
Close to public transportation (82 bus, and green line) 
8 minuets from United Center
24 minuets to Navy Pier
23 minutes to Oak Street Beach
25 minuets to The free Lincoln Park Zoo
19 minuets from Millennium Park/Grant park
24 minuets to Shed Aquarium, the field museum and the Adler planetarium.

We recommend to use Uber/Lyft for easy access to the city. 
The green line is also very close and will take you into downtown. 3 min walk to CTA and train!

You will be sharing common areas with other guests, bathroom, kitchen, living room and dining room. Be mindful of the other guests and clean up behind yourselves. Your room is your private space and each room has a key to lock up your things when your a gone.

access: It’s private entry with garage parking and washer and dryer in unit. This is Not a shared space guest have the entire apartment to themselves.
description:
This place is a 2 bedroom modern apt with a very cozy feel. Located in a central part of the city close to the highway. Bonus room for office space/yoga. Stainless steel appliances throughout & Smart TV.

Located in a secure gated building on the south side. King size bed W/Temper-Pedic Cloud Lux mattresses. The 2nd room has a memory foam full size sleigh bed, Its located 15 minutes from downtown, 5 min to Metra trains, public transportation, shopping centers, GNC, chipotle, Starbucks & more.

In a 5 min proximity to shopping centers, public transportation, the library 90/94 and I-57 expressway. The beautiful Downtown Chicago is an easy 15/20 minute drive! Close to lake Shore drive and several beaches and museums as well.

It’s private entry with garage parking and washer and dryer in unit. This is Not a shared space guest have the entire apartment to themselves.

I’m available when needed feel free to call or text me with any questions.

Very central location, close to everything. This neighborhood is up and coming and has single family homes and many working class families. It can be a bit noisy with the school across the street but for the most part it’s very family oriented. Its a residential building so please be considerate of the neighbors and keep quiet after 10pm. We all look out for one another and it’s safe. My building has a secure locked gate, private garage entry and surveillance cameras for added protection.

Garage space is available as long as you notify me ahead of time I’ll leave the garage opener in the kitchen drawer closest to the fridge. Uber, Metra and public transportation within a block or two.

The metal on the front gate swells in the summer heat so it takes a firm push on the metal at times to open the gate. We keep it oiled for easier access.

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1. Reservations require a $500 security deposit that is not charged in advance.

2. Guests can cancel free of charge within 24 hours of booking (please contact us to process the refund). You’ll be charged 50% of the booking price (minus the service fee) if you cancel more than seven days before arrival, and 100% of the total price if you cancel within seven days of arrival.

3. Check-in is at 4 pm. Checkout is at 11 am. Early check-in or late checkout may be available upon request. Guests who stay beyond their designated checkout time or delay our housekeeping staff are liable for any associated costs and expenses.

4. Guests are not allowed to make a reservation in their city of residence. Please contact us if you're booking within your city.

5. Smoking, parties, and excessive noise are not allowed, including on balconies and in shared spaces. Smoking violations are subject to a $250 fine plus the cost to clean, deodorize, and repair damages.

6. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, Illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited.

7. Overnight guests that exceed the number stated in the reservation are not allowed.

8. Pets are not allowed. Violation of our pet policy may result in a fine. We encourage guests with service animals to contact us before their stay.

9. Guests are responsible for covering the cost to replace lost keys, key cards, fobs, or parking passes.

10. Sonder properties may use video surveillance in public areas. Noise detecting technology may be used inside the suite to monitor excessive noise levels. 

11. Guests take full responsibility for damages, injury, or loss that occur on the premises and its facilities. Guests must report any property damage to customer service. Unreported damages will be deducted from the security deposit.

12. Booking a reservation constitutes an agreement to comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

description:
Featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, and Fast Company, we’ve hosted over 350k guests in 2,500+ spaces with an average rating of 4.6 stars. Each space is designed and run by us, so you’ll always know what to expect from your stay. At Sonder, we’ve combined the best parts of home and hotel.

- 24/7 support via text, email, or phone
- Coffee, fresh towels, and bathroom essentials provided
- Hotel-standard cleaning before you arrive

- In-suite laundry
- Fully-equipped kitchen
- Private desk

Near North highlights
- Walkability score: 97
- 8 minute drive to Quartino Ristorante (delicious Italian cuisine)
- 4 minute drive to The Green Door Tavern (comfy, laid-back pub)

Getting around
- 1 mile to Chicago Ave 'L' Station (Brown/Purple Line)
- 10 minute drive to downtown
- 52 minute drive to MDW Airport
- 59 minute drive to ORD Airport

Known as one of Chicago’s most livable and walkable neighborhoods, Near North is the place to be for endless shopping, dining, and entertainment. Fill your day by wandering along the famous Magnificent Mile, admiring the city skyline at the Chicago River, or simply enjoying a drink on one of the many rooftops. From sun up to sun down, the lively streets of this neighborhood are bustling with people.

There’s no cable. We’ve provided an HDMI cord for streaming.

This apartment is available for stays of 30 nights or more. If this Sonder isn't open for your dates, please contact us to see what else we have available.

access: You will have access to the entire living space of the house. 3 floors of living space with a full bedroom and bath in the first floor, living room, dining room and kitchen in the second floor and a master bedroom with full master bath as well as a very nice and spacious outdoor deck in the 3rd floor.
description:
PERFECT for FAMILIES! Spacious Townhome in the hearth of the city! 3 stories and 1500 sq feet of living space. Steps from the Train and just a 10 minute ride to downtown Millennium Park. My Townhome offers 3 Queen beds for sleeping up to 6 guests comfortably in 2 bedrooms with 2 full bathrooms. Potential to accommodate a couple more guests is possible please check with me for arrangements. Near grocery shops, Shopping,  great restaurants, Theaters, the Chicago Zoo and everything  Chicago offers.

This is a vary spacious Townhome in a secluded and very quite tree lined street but next to shops and transportation. Complete with washer and dryer, a 65 inch smart TV, smart speakers through out and a fully stocked kitchen. It can comfortably sleep 6 guests and if needed we can discuss couch and airbeds for an additional couple of guests. Parking is included in the stay trough residential permits or I can make a garage spot available.

You will have access to the entire living space of the house. 3 floors of living space with a full bedroom and bath in the first floor, living room, dining room and kitchen in the second floor and a master bedroom with full master bath as well as a very nice and spacious outdoor deck in the 3rd floor.

I will greet you in person and can provide answers to any question about places to visit and things to do in Chicago. Occasionally if I am busy I can provide a self check in option as well.

Lincoln Park at its best. Probably one of the best areas to stay in the city with many shops and restaurants at your door steps and the CTA train station not even half a block away. You yave Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Mariano's and Aldi for your grocery shopping all within 2 block from home. Also a miryad of restaurants such as Alinea rated best restaurant in the world 3 years in a row. Shopping and theaters complement your stay and train ride to Millennium Park is just 10 minutes.

CTA Train station North and Clybourne is steps away and it can take you directly into downtown and the loop etc in less than 10 minutes. It also takes you straight to Wrigleyville and the cubs stadium in 10 minutes. The North ave bus can take you to the Lake, the Chicago History Museum and the Lincoln Park zoo in a straight shot or you can even walk over there. In the opposite direction the same bus can take you to Bucktown / Wicker Park another vibrant and Hipster neighborhood of Chicago.
From the airport es easy to access by train just hop on the blue line to downtown then transfer to the redline to home. About 1 hour for the entire ride. An Uber or Lyft ride would be about 40 Minutes in normal traffic. Uber and Lyft are always available with less than a 5 minute wait.

Parking is included through residential permits. Garage parking may be available upon request.

access: You'll have full access to my two-level, three-bedroom home.
description:
Welcome to our expansive, light-filled duplex in Bucktown! Massive deck just off the kitchen, which will probably be your favorite "room" on warm summer evenings. Close to the Western blue line station, easy to get here from O'Hare, and you'll love staying in this dynamic, convenient neighborhood, where there's always a new restaurant or shop opening up (as well as plenty of places that have been open for generations) - book today!

You'll enter our place onto a bright main level that's dominated by common living space - the kitchen, dining area, and living room are all here, as well as a half-bath. There's a huge covered deck just off the kitchen as well. On the lower level are three bedrooms - including the master with an ensuite bathroom - and another full bathroom.

You'll have full access to my two-level, three-bedroom home.

I live in the condo above so you may see me from time to time! Say HI :)

One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

We're just a couple of blocks from the Western Blue line station, and steps from the Armitage, Western Ave, and Damen bus lines - it's easy to get around without a car here!

additional_house_rules:
1) Vaping only is allowed on your private balcony, with the balcony door shut. The rest of the property is smoke and vapor free. We have marijuana and tobacco chemical sensors on the property. They know it's not cooking smoke, They react to airborne particulate, not the smell on your clothes. The PolySens® technology works, so exit the building if you want to smoke/vape or you'll be fined $500 and asked to leave.

2) Your reservation has paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number, whether visiting or sleeping, you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first.

3) Quiet hours are 10PM-8AM. Noise should not be heard coming from your apartment. This is a quiet residential building. 95% of our guests have no issues, and never hear from us. We will be sure to send you at least 2 warnings prior to asking anyone to leave, but one way or another, the apartment must be quiet.

4) Parties, events, and commercial activity are not allowed.

5) We reserve the right to ask you to leave without a refund if any of the above rules are broken.

6) Lost keys will incur a $100 charge. We have to change the locks. Please use the app to send a picture of all the keys at check-in AND check-out.

7) We do not accept instant bookings from residents of the Chicago metropolitan area as identified by profile city or phone number area code. If you live near Chicago and would like to book a stay, please send us a message with a little more information about your plans

8) Our favorite restaurant in Chicago is La Scarola.

Privacy Statement on the Use of Security Cameras:
We respect and value the privacy of our guests. We will never place a camera inside a living space. While Airbnb policy allows cameras in spaces that are not used for sleeping or bathing, we disagree. Cameras should be banned from inside all living spaces. Footage should be automatically deleted. Everything should be disclosed in advance. We use hallway security cameras to verify the number of guests who have entered an apartment. This is useful for stopping parties, and under additional prices extra guest charges may apply for extra people sleeping over. We use a camera on the balcony to monitor for smoking. This area is publicly visible from the street. All footage is deleted automatically after a stay, unless there is an open resolution center case. It’s unfortunate that not every guest is honest about their intentions, and our community would not allow us to be on Airbnb if we did not prevent unwanted behaviors. Let us know if you have questions. We have nothing to hide.

access:
The entire apartment is yours during your stay! 
Book for one person or seven, it doesn't matter - you WILL NOT share this apartment with anyone outside of your own group! 

The building does not offer any common amenities.
There is one free parking space on site included with the unit.
description:
Sleep in a luxurious glass palace condo on the downtown leaning edge of Chicago's ultra hip Wicker Park neighborhood! Step around the corner from the Blue Line L train - 10 minutes to downtown. Enjoy more square feet, a glass rain shower, high end appliances, custom cabinetry, granite counters, Brazilian cherry floors and needed from detergent to coffee and cream stocked! Skip the cheap apartments with good photos and fake finishes; this ultra luxurious glass palace of a condo is the real deal!

Flooded with natural light and ceilings that soar to 11 feet, the feeling is airy, spacious, modern, ultra luxury.   Not just a bathtub, but a giant soaking tub.  Not just a shower, but a custom glass rain shower large enough to spin around.  Enjoy a private patio with actual privacy, blazingly fast WiFi, a wealth of coffee options/equipment, Q-tips, cotton balls, detergent, and more all stocked! This space goes so far above and beyond what you'll find in a hotel - prepare to be shocked, then amazed, and then just happy.  

Want advice?  Looking for that local knowledge? We've got a guidebook telling you all the secrets! We're from Chicago. We live here. We know the place, and we have an opinion! 


MASTER BEDROOM
- One queen bed
- Dresser and mirror
- Room darkening shades
- Balcony view
- Walk in closet
- Ensuite bathroom
- Brazilian cherry floors

SECOND BEDROOM
- Queen bed
- Room darkening shades
- Balcony view
- 2 closets
- Brazilian cherry floors

LIVING ROOM
- One queen bed
- One queen sofa sleeper
- 55" HDTV with built in streaming


DESIGNER CHEF'S KITCHEN 
- High-end stainless steel appliances 
- Dual fuel electric oven and gas range
- Tiled backsplashes
- Granite island counter space
- Slow close custom cabinetry 

STOCKED IN YOUR APARTMENT
Whole bean and ground coffee
Sweeteners
Half/Half
Dish Soap
Dish Detergent
Laundry Soap
Cotton Balls
Q-Tips
Hand Soap
Toilet Paper
Paper Towels
Salt/Pepper/Oil
Shampoo/Conditioner/Bodywash
Hand Moisturizer


MASTER BATHROOM 
- Deep jacuzzi soaking tub
- Glass walled rain shower 
- Marble tiling and concrete countertops
- Wall mounted commode

GUEST BATHROOM 
- Deep soaking tub / shower combination
- Full glass countertop
- Wall mounted commode
Towels, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash provided for every guest!

Be productive with high speed WiFi, writing desk and desk chair! 
Take a break with HD Roku streaming TV!

Enjoy a PRIVATE PATIO with zero-g seating!
Brazilian cherry wood flooring throughout!

-----------
PARKING
ONE outdoor parking space is included with this rental. The space is yours from 12PM the day of check-in until 11AM the day of check-out, but not before or after. We will provide you with the space number. We have recommendations for paid parking if you need additional spaces. XL vehicles like Ford Expedition or F-450 will not fit in these 96" wide spaces. If you go over the line, you'll be towed.
----------
CHECK-IN TIME 
Typically, guests may receive the keys and drop their bags in the apartment as early as 12PM (noon). The cleaners do need until 4PM to do their work, and the apartment may be dirty anytime until 4.  
If you'd like to drop your bags early and head out until the cleaners finish, we can usually accommodate you! If you'd like to take a nap or shower right away, and the night before your stay isn't booked yet, let's discuss booking that night before! Then you could arrive as early as you'd like that day! 
----------
CHECK-OUT TIME
11AM is check-out. If you'll need a check-out after 11AM, and the night after your stay isn't booked yet, let's chat about booking that next night! Then you could leave as late as you'd like that day!
We *do* have a luggage locker a block away!
----------
OCCUPANCY 
Upon booking, your reservation will have paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number whether visiting or sleeping,  you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first. 
We consider the maximum capacity of the apartment to be its sleeping capacity - eight individuals. Anyone past eight would not be permitted. 
Enjoy the city! Please don’t bring a party back.
----------
RATES
Rates and minimum stays change constantly - every night is different! 
The nightly rate changes based on number of guests, which is verified upon arrival. Please do your best to let me know how many guests will be staying in advance!
----------
The pictures you see have accurate furniture, finishes, square footage - really everything! The art and positioning of items *might* be slightly different. Please don’t be concerned! Read the reviews! I assure you that the photos accurately represent what you will receive!

The entire apartment is yours during your stay! 
Book for one person or seven, it doesn't matter - you WILL NOT share this apartment with anyone outside of your own group! 

The building does not offer any common amenities.
There is one free parking space on site included with the unit.

We love our guests! We are available to our guests! 
We text our guests most of what they need! 
...WE NEED A NUMBER TO REACH YOU AT! 
Please confirm your phone number and email address upon booking.

IF YOU WILL NOT HAVE A US PHONE NUMBER, please download the Whats App phone texting app! We also have We Chat - please provide your ID!

WICKER PARK! 
The apartment is located in the center of Chicago's hipster haven! This awesome neighborhood has so many bars, restaurants, independent coffee joints and quirky shops you'll have no idea where to start - until you check out our curated guidebook! We'll give you a taste for starters.

CHEESIES, a casual bar up Milwaukee Avenue, has killer grilled cheese. The Popper is the best choice on the menu. We've only been after a few drinks, but we see people there all day. Good sign. 
EMPORIUM ARCADE BAR WICKER PARK is great for games and drinks. The cocktails are a little pricey, but you can play pinball for hours.  
PIECE PIZZA AND BREWERY has the best New Haven style pizza outside of Connecticut, and even better, it's not from New York! Their Hefeweizen is top notch, and they have live music all the time.
And at PODHALANKA you'll experience a Polish grandmother's welcome by stuffing you with blintzes, pierogies, and roast beef - and not taking 'please, no more' for an answer. 

We’ve got tips about hidden speakeasy’s and burlesque shows, coffee shops and grab-and-go breakfast, high-end can't miss dinners, quick meals, late nights and boozy brunch, plus extensive day trips all throughout the city. We put our heart into it, and you’ll find advice on other can’t-miss places worth a train or Uber ride, including FIVE distinct nightlife districts throughout the city!

There's no need for a car here!
- You're a 1 minute walk from the Division Blue Line L train! 
7 minutes to downtown!
- INSTANTLY get an Uber or Lyft! This neighborhood has no waiting.

Take the CTA and go from front door to Chicago's... 

SELFIE SPOTS
- Millennium Park, the Bean (Cloud Gate), Maggie Daley Park: 18 min
- Riverwalk: 18 min
- Sears Tower / Willis Tower (Skydeck Chicago): 20 min
- Magnificent Mile / Michigan Avenue shopping, Hancock Center (360 Chicago), Water Tower: 29 min
- Lake Michigan, Oak Street Beach (terrific skyline view): 20 min

WORLD-CLASS CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS
- Art Institute of Chicago: 17 min
- Grant Park, Buckingham Fountain, Chicago Marathon start: 23 min
- Lincoln Park Zoo: 28 min (best free zoo in the world!)
- Museum Campus, Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium: 31 min
- Chicago Symphony Orchestra: 17 min
- Gene Siskel Film Center: 10 min
- Museum of Contemporary Art: 18 min
- Museum of Science and Industry (MSI): 20 min Uber


BIGGEST THEATER SCENE OUTSIDE OF BROADWAY
- The Chicago Theatre: 11 min
- CIBC Theatre (Hamilton): 11 min
- Goodman Theatre: 12 min
- The Joffrey Ballet: 13 min
- Auditorium Theater of Roosevelt University: 18 min
- Lyric Opera: 20 min
- Lookingglass Theater Company: 17 min
- Steppenwolf Theatre: 20 min
- The Second City: 24 min

SPORTS AND STADIUMS
- Northerly Island Pavilion: 32 min
- Cubs baseball and Wrigley Field: 31 min
- Blackhawks Hockey, Bulls basketball, United Center: 18 min
- Bears football and Soldier Field: 35 min
- Guaranteed Rate Park, Chicago White Sox: 35 min (we're Cubs fans, but they have good food, and tickets are cheap)
- Wintrust Arena: 24 min
- Allstate Arena, Rosemont: 23 min Uber

CONCERTS AND FESTIVALS
- Concord Music Hall: 8 min
- House of Blues: 15 min
- House of Vans: 22 min
- City Winery (West Loop): 24 min
- Lollapalooza: 23 min
- The Vic Theatre: 28 min

UNIVERSITIES AND COLLEGES
- University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC): 22 min
- DePaul University: 10 min Uber
- The University of Chicago: 21 min Uber
- Northwestern University, Evanston: 30 min Uber

CONVENTION CENTERS
- Merchandise Mart: 17 min
- McCormick Place: 15 min Uber
- Donald E Stephens Convention Center, Rosemont: 39 min or 19 min Uber

AIRPORTS AND TRANSPORTATION
- O'Hare (ORD): 37 min direct!
- Midway (MDW): 42 min
- Union Station (Amtrak): 21 min
- Millennium Station (South Shore Line): 13 min
- Ogilvie Transportation Center (Metra): 17 min

OVERRATED TOURIST TRAP
- Navy Pier: 28 min
Unless you have plans at the Children's Museum, Shakespeare Theater, or Imax theater - seriously, skip it. Ask us for recommendations instead.

Unit may be accessed by maintenance for repairs during stays.

We do not accept instant bookings from residents of the Chicago metropolitan area as identified by profile city or phone number area code. If you live near Chicago and would like to book a stay, please send us a message with a little more information about your plans

Immediately after booking, we will send you a few questions about your arrival time, contact info, number of guests/visitors, and to name our favorite restaurant, which is listed at the bottom of the house rules. Guests will not be allowed to check in without providing complete answers

ONE outdoor parking space is included with this rental. The space is yours from 12PM the day of check-in until 11AM the day of check-out, but not before or after. We will provide you with the space number. We have recommendations for paid parking if you need additional spaces. XL vehicles like Ford Expedition or F-450 will not fit in these 96" wide spaces. If you go over the line, you'll be towed.
----------
CHECK-IN TIME 
Typically, guests may receive the keys and drop their bags in the apartment as early as 12PM (noon). The cleaners do need until 4PM to do their work, and the apartment may be dirty anytime until 4.  
If you'd like to drop your bags early and head out until the cleaners finish, we can usually accommodate you! If you'd like to take a nap or shower right away, and the night before your stay isn't booked yet, let's discuss booking that night before! Then you could arrive as early as you'd like that day! 
----------
CHECK-OUT TIME
11AM is check-out. If you'll need a check-out after 11AM, and the night after your stay isn't booked yet, let's chat about booking that next night! Then you could leave as late as you'd like that day!
We *do* have a luggage locker a block away!
----------
OCCUPANCY 
Upon booking, your reservation will have paid for a specific number of guests on it. Anyone over this number whether visiting or sleeping,  you must have written permission from us. We have a hallway camera to verify. We're going to be totally fine with 95% of requests, but we do require you to clear it with us first. 
We consider the maximum capacity of the apartment to be its sleeping capacity - eight individuals. Anyone past eight would not be permitted. 
Enjoy the city! Please don’t bring a party back.
----------
RATES
Rates and minimum stays change constantly - every night is different! 
The nightly rate changes based on number of guests, which is verified upon arrival. Please do your best to let me know how many guests will be staying in advance!
----------
The pictures you see have accurate furniture, finishes, square footage - really everything! The art and positioning of items *might* be slightly different. Please don’t be concerned! Read the reviews! I assure you that the photos accurately represent what you will receive!
summary: Sleep in a luxurious glass palace condo on the downtown leaning edge of Chicago's ultra hip Wicker Park neighborhood! Step around the corner from the Blue Line L train - 10 minutes to downtown. Enjoy more square feet, a glass rain shower, high end appliances, custom cabinetry, granite counters, Brazilian cherry floors and needed from detergent to coffee and cream stocked! Skip the cheap apartments with good photos and fake finishes; this ultra luxurious glass palace of a condo is the real deal!
transit:
There's no need for a car here!
- You're a 1 minute walk from the Division Blue Line L train! 
7 minutes to downtown!
- INSTANTLY get an Uber or Lyft! This neighborhood has no waiting.

Take the CTA and go from front door to Chicago's... 

SELFIE SPOTS
- Millennium Park, the Bean (Cloud Gate), Maggie Daley Park: 18 min
- Riverwalk: 18 min
- Sears Tower / Willis Tower (Skydeck Chicago): 20 min
- Magnificent Mile / Michigan Avenue shopping, Hancock Center (360 Chicago), Water Tower: 29 min
- Lake Michigan, Oak Street Beach (terrific skyline view): 20 min

WORLD-CLASS CULTURAL INSTITUTIONS
- Art Institute of Chicago: 17 min
- Grant Park, Buckingham Fountain, Chicago Marathon start: 23 min
- Lincoln Park Zoo: 28 min (best free zoo in the world!)
- Museum Campus, Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium: 31 min
- Chicago Symphony Orchestra: 17 min
- Gene Siskel Film Center: 10 min
- Museum of Contemporary Art: 18 min
- Museum of Science and Industry (MSI): 20 min Uber


BIGGEST THEATER SCENE OUTSIDE OF BROADWAY
- The Chicago Theatre: 11 min
- CIBC Theatre (Hamilton): 11 min
- Goodman Theatre: 12 min
- The Joffrey Ballet: 13 min
- Auditorium Theater of Roosevelt University: 18 min
- Lyric Opera: 20 min
- Lookingglass Theater Company: 17 min
- Steppenwolf Theatre: 20 min
- The Second City: 24 min

SPORTS AND STADIUMS
- Northerly Island Pavilion: 32 min
- Cubs baseball and Wrigley Field: 31 min
- Blackhawks Hockey, Bulls basketball, United Center: 18 min
- Bears football and Soldier Field: 35 min
- Guaranteed Rate Park, Chicago White Sox: 35 min (we're Cubs fans, but they have good food, and tickets are cheap)
- Wintrust Arena: 24 min
- Allstate Arena, Rosemont: 23 min Uber

CONCERTS AND FESTIVALS
- Concord Music Hall: 8 min
- House of Blues: 15 min
- House of Vans: 22 min
- City Winery (West Loop): 24 min
- Lollapalooza: 23 min
- The Vic Theatre: 28 min

UNIVERSITIES AND COLLEGES
- University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC): 22 min
- DePaul University: 10 min Uber
- The University of Chicago: 21 min Uber
- Northwestern University, Evanston: 30 min Uber

CONVENTION CENTERS
- Merchandise Mart: 17 min
- McCormick Place: 15 min Uber
- Donald E Stephens Convention Center, Rosemont: 39 min or 19 min Uber

AIRPORTS AND TRANSPORTATION
- O'Hare (ORD): 37 min direct!
- Midway (MDW): 42 min
- Union Station (Amtrak): 21 min
- Millennium Station (South Shore Line): 13 min
- Ogilvie Transportation Center (Metra): 17 min

OVERRATED TOURIST TRAP
- Navy Pier: 28 min
Unless you have plans at the Children's Museum, Shakespeare Theater, or Imax theater - seriously, skip it. Ask us for recommendations instead.

description:
*New Listing*
Experienced superhosts have expanded to a new space. This rental is a private, eclectic, adorable living space with queen bed in private bedroom with private bathroom, access to washer/dryer and free parking. Rental includes kitchenette amenities and private entrance. Guests have access to Wi-Fi and Netflix. Perfect destination 22 miles from Chicago in a quiet neighborhood bursting with charm. Smoking outdoors in the back only.

This private rental is a darling space with a queen bed in private bedroom with full bath and living room  in Lombard, IL. 
This rental includes access to kitchenette amenities such as sink, microwave, refrigerator/freezer, Keurig coffee maker and disposable plates/cups. 
We are located in a quiet neighborhood situated 22 miles west of Chicago (35 minutes in good traffic and an hour in bad traffic) and close to major highways such as I-290 (10 minutes away), I-355 (5 minutes away), I-294 (10 minutes away), and I-88 (15 minutes away).

We have used and loved Airbnb to stay at great spots across the country and world. We are experienced superhosts and have been hosting with Airbnb since 2015. We are excited to share our new space and welcome guests! We live on the premises but can and will give guests as much space as possible unless otherwise requested. Since rental space is private, guests determine how much social interaction they would like.

Gillian’s home is located in Lombard, Illinois, United States.
Our home is within walking distance to several outdoor green areas and running and biking paths, the Great Western Trail, the Illinois Prairie Path and beautiful Lilacia Park.

We are one mile from downtown Lombard boasting coffee shops, local eateries, rooftop deli, cocktail lounge and boutiques. We are also a quick ten minute drive from Yorktown Shopping Center via I-355 which has an array of great dining choices as well as shopping.

We are located one mile north of the Metra Union Pacific West train line which runs between downtown Chicago and Elburn, IL.

We have a small dog named Indigo who is very sweet (Beagle/Basset/Pointer mix). To make sure she does not escape, we ask that you always close the gate before and after you park your car.

Since rental space is private, guests determine how much social interaction they would like.

access: Except for the private rooms, which have locks, guests will have access to most other areas of the home.
description:
Rowula House has two bedrooms in the upper level apartment, both are for rent to guests. Guests rooms are private, but will share living room and dining area, furnished exclusively for their use. There is an exercise bike, an exercise ball, and an exercise swing walker on the veranda for guests' use. Scrabble, Checkers table, Chess board and Decks of cards are in the house for guests' entertainment. So also are some Chicago tourist info booklets, activities brochures and books on hand for guest.

Rowula House guests will have access to supplies for free self-made continental breakfast. Bread, butter, creamer, coffee and tea will be in the home for guests use.
 Additionaly, regular travelers items will be stocked in drawers  at very reasonable prices for purchase, should guests need things such as non-alcoholic beverages, shaving sticks, etc.. in addition to the provided free toiletries. By traditional honor system, guests could buy those. 
The whole house is a smoke-free zone, but guests have a smoking area outside in the fenced lawn.

Except for the private rooms, which have locks, guests will have access to most other areas of the home.

Omar, the owner, works in the hospitality industry and sometimes stays in the basement apartment with it's separate bedroom, bathroom and amenities. Guests, while guaranteed privacy in their apartment, could reach the host by phone for assistance when he is around.

Rowula House is a short distance from the historic Jackson Park, the soon to become home of the former President Barack Obama's presidential library, with it's state of the art habor station, long beach front, a birds sanctuary, and a golf course right next to the South Shore Cultural Center. 
The University of Chicago campus and hospitals in the neighboring Hyde Park neighborhood is just a few miles away. And the new extension of Lake Shore Drive, which next to Rowula House, snakes along the entire length of Lake Michigan's beautiful sand beaches with bicycle tracks that makes the run every cyclist's dream.

A Metra Station is just around the corner from Rowula House. Metra trains run from Chicago's downtown Union Station to all corners of the Windy City and the surrounding Suburds. Next to the homes are also located several CTA bus and train stops. Additionally, Omar, a public chauffer, is able to pick-up and drop off guests from and to airports and local tourists attractions.

Guests should expect a very warm welcome from a host whose experience working in the Guest Services department  of a hotel qualifies him to provide exceptional hospitality. As a public chauffer, his customer service experience has also prepared him to meet, greet, and comfortably interact with guests from many social and cultural backgrounds.
interaction: Omar, the owner, works in the hospitality industry and sometimes stays in the basement apartment with it's separate bedroom, bathroom and amenities. Guests, while guaranteed privacy in their apartment, could reach the host by phone for assistance when he is around.

additional_house_rules:
- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout

description:
Gorgeous Studio Unit in the heart of Chicago - Rivernorth. Professionally managed and fully stocked w/ everything from salt, pepper, shampoo and body-wash to a sparkling water welcome gift!

We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

Cozy and modern apartment units situated along Chicago's River North District. A few minutes away from the Chicago Riverwalk, the Puerto Convention Center and the Shedd Aquarium, along with hundreds of art galleries and local museums. The brown and the purple lines are the main mode of transportation in the city. Amenities include a 24Hr fitness center, a business center with wifi hot spots, pet friendly accommodation and a rooftop swimming pool. All units include a modern kitchen, floor to ceiling windows, in-unit washer/dryers and flat screen TV's. Free fast wifi, kitchen/cookware and bathroom amenities are also provided. For any concerns, our amazing customer support team is available to assist.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests
house_rules:
- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout
interaction: We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

description:
This is a private room in a shared 4BR apartment (all 4 rooms are available on Airbnb). Restaurants, shops, bars, and public transit are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 10-minute train ride away via the nearby Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station.

Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.

Thanks so much for your interest in staying with us! We ask that you read through our entire listing to make sure that we're the right hosts for you. This is a private room in a shared 4BR apartment (all 4 rooms are available on Airbnb). 

THIS TROVE HAS

✔ Queen-size bed
✔ 55" HDTV w/ Netflix (no cable TV)
✔ Keurig coffee maker
✔ Body wash and shampoo
✔ Iron and ironing board
✔ Hair dryer
✔ Keyless Entry

--and more!

EXCLUSIVE TROVE PERKS

During your stay as a Trove guest, you receive a free membership to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower.  Included with your membership:

✔ Upscale co-working space, dining, and bars
✔ Stunning views of Chicago and Lake Michigan
✔ Discounted express tickets to the Willis Tower Skydeck

Metropolitan Club Hours:

Monday–Friday: 7am – 10pm
Saturday: 5pm – 10pm
Sunday: Closed

HAVE A QUESTION?

Check out the “Other Things to Note” section of this listing for the answers to our most frequently asked questions.

In addition to your room, you'll have shared access to the kitchen, living room, dining room, bathrooms, and washer/dryer.

We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Fullerton Red/Brown/Purple Line 'L' train station is a 10-minute walk away.
→ O'Hare is 55 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?”

Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're around the corner from the Wrightwood 659 art gallery. Search for “Wrightwood 659 Gallery Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest.

2. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room.

Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest.

3. “Can a third person stay in the room with me?”

We allow a maximum of two guests per room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more than two people. Send us a message for more info.

4. Will I have my own private bathroom?

The apartment has two shared bathrooms.

description:
Newly Renovated! Spacious 3 Bedroom, 2 Full Bath Apartment in Rogers Park. One block from Beach, with swim access! Walking distance from Loyola University, CTA transit, local shops and restaurants. Perfect for groups with a brand new kitchen, queen beds, and open space for lounging and entertaining. Comfortable and airy, with tons of natural light and hardwood floors throughout!

Recently renovated, with hardwood floors and natural light throughout the apartment. Great location right on N. Sheridan road, with Loyola University minutes away and the beach right behind you! The beach has sand and is swimmable with a lifeguard on duty. A great, large apartment for your group stay in Chicago.

Guests have access to the entire apartment and the laundry (coin operated) in the basement. You are free to use the private back entrance off the kitchen during your stay - just make sure all doors are locked behind you! Thank you!

I may or may not be in town during your stay. However, I will always be available by phone! For any emergencies or maintenance issues, our team will have someone there to help as soon as possible. Thank you!

Rogers Park is a beautiful, university neighborhood on the north side of Chicago. With the beach, city, and university so close, it is a dynamic and diverse location!

access:
Private Room (with lock and key)
Kitchen/Dining area
Laundry Space
Both Restrooms
Back Porch for smoking
Roof Top (through back porch)
description:
My house is also an art gallery for local Chicago artists.
The art on these walls are continuously rotating pieces from a diverse group nationally and locally recognized.

This listing is for a private room but a listing for the entire gallery is also available.
Onsite free washer and dryer, dishwasher, wifi, and roof access. 
1.5 bath (only one bathroom has a shower)
Bathrooms also have free hospitality amenities provided to guests.
Each room has its own individual lock for privacy and security.
No shoes on carpet.
Smoking is not permitted, but you can feel free to smoke on the rooftop deck.
This listing is for a private room but a listing for the entire gallery is available.

Private Room (with lock and key)
Kitchen/Dining area
Laundry Space
Both Restrooms
Back Porch for smoking
Roof Top (through back porch)

I will not be onsite to allow my guests privacy, but I am available for emergencies or to provide tips on where to eat and sight-see.

We are centrally located in the nexus of 3 historical neighborhoods (Bronzeville, Kenwood, and Oakland).
Full of Cafes, Historical Landmarks, 15 min drive to downtown, and 20 min walk (3 min drive) to the BEACH!

We are conveniently in between I-90 and Lake Shore Drive (LSD)
These two expressways will connect you to any part of Chicago
Not driving? No problem! Two bus stops are located on your corner
43rd St Bus: Connects you to Red & Green Line Trains, & 41ST Beach
Cottage Grove Bus: Connects you to Downtown Michigan Avenue, Millennium Park, Museum Campus (Adler Planetarium, America's first planetarium; the Shedd Aquarium; the Field Museum of Natural History; & Soldier Field, home of the NFL Chicago Bears football team), Hyde Park, & Red and Green Line Trains

This listing is for a private room but a listing for the entire gallery is available.
house_rules:
Do not touch the art
No shoes in the house
Well mannered children +10 yrs are welcomed
Smoking permitted only on back porch and roof.
Kitchen and appliances must be left clean and tidy, dishes done and stowed, dishwasher emptied, garbage disposed of.

access:
Guests have access to 2 bedroom apartment with keypad entry.  Laundry and a small dining area available in rear stair.

Though I find street parking  easy and ample, I have two garage parking spaces that are first come, first serve at $20/night. 

Early check-in/late check-out (should it be a matter of an hour here, two hours there) is offered free whenever possible. Should guests require access to the place beyond those margins, that access is available for a reasonable and negotiable fee.
description:
Spacious two bedroom apartment in Humboldt Park.  Nice, residential street offers easy walk to busy Wicker Park, Bucktown, Logan Square restaurants, bars, nightlife and CTA Blue Line to access broader city. Sprawling green Humboldt Park and elevated Bloomingdale Trail nearby. Guests enjoy separate entrance with keypad entry.

Two bedrooms, each with a queen bed. Kitchen and bath are well stocked and functional.  Its a casual, well-furnished spot offering relaxation and a base for your adventures

The apartment is cozy, casual, and up-to-date.  There are queen sized beds in two bedrooms, a kitchen with a breakfast table, a well-stocked bathroom and a couch for cable TV and Netflix. Good WiFi and easy access to a cool neighborhood and broader Chicago.

Guests have access to 2 bedroom apartment with keypad entry.  Laundry and a small dining area available in rear stair.

Though I find street parking  easy and ample, I have two garage parking spaces that are first come, first serve at $20/night. 

Early check-in/late check-out (should it be a matter of an hour here, two hours there) is offered free whenever possible. Should guests require access to the place beyond those margins, that access is available for a reasonable and negotiable fee.

I live nearby and can generally provide in person help when needed.  Pretty much always available by phone.  If I'm out of town or unavailable, I have fixit guys and friends around to correct whatever may have gone awry.  I'm around the exterior of the place every do often for maintenance and the like, but won't be in your way.

The neighborhood is residential with a neighborhood garden on the corner.  Just to your west is Humboldt Park, a sprawling green space for jogging, baseball, soccer, tennis, kids play areas, duck feeding, and a little restaurant/bar in a pavilion rising above a pond.  Slightly farther away is the 606 Bloomingdale Trail, an elevated bike trail for walkers, joggers, cyclists and such.  Take a fifteen minute walk to the intersection of Damen, Milwaukee, and North Avenues, the nexus of one of the premier neighborhoods for Chicago nightlife and shopping.  Easy train ride to the loop attractions and lakefront.  Plenty to do and a good location to access it all.

The city of chicago is at your disposal with trains, buses, taxis, ride-sharing, Divy bikes and your own two feet.  CTA Blue Line stops, Damen and Western, are each about a 15 minute walk away.  Three Divy bike rental stands are but a few minute walk away. Street parking is free and generally ample.  I have a garage that I'm willing to rent at $20/night if spots are available.

Cable TV and wifi available. 

Though I find street parking  easy and ample, Ihave two garage parking spaces that are first come, first serve at $20/night. 

Early check-in/late check-out (should it be a matter of an hour here, two hours there) is offered free whenever possible. Should guests require access to the place beyond those margins, that access is available for a reasonable and negotiable fee.

access: Guest have access to the entire apartment.
description:
2 bedroom garden apartment with private entrance. Kitchen offers stove, refrigerator, microwave, and breakfast bar.  One private bathroom.  Living room with 55” smart tv.  Close to both the green line and blue line.  2 blocks from Oak Park, IL.  Street Parking is available. You can get down town in 20-30 minutes.

Guest have access to the entire space.   There are two bedrooms with queen beds in both rooms. Living room has a 55” smart tv with Roku.  Kitchen is equipped with stove, refrigerator, microwave, coffee pot, toaster, tea kettle, pot/pans, and dishes.

Guest have access to the entire apartment.

I am always available via text.  I like to give people what they are comfortable with.  I will check in to make sure all is well.

Austin is one of the largest communities in the city of Chicago.  We have great architecture, families, and churches.  We are close to everything with quick and easy transportation to down town Chicago or downtown Oak Park.  I love this community! I’m a 25+ year resident.

Close to both the green line and blue line.  2 blocks from Oak Park, IL.  Street Parking is available. You can get to down town Chicago in 20-30 minutes and down town Oak Park in less than 10 minutes.

Uber and Lyft are your friends in Chicago.  It’s a great way to get around the city.  From this location your stop on the Blue or Green line el train would be Austin Blvd. (which is the street that separates Chicago from the suburb of Oak Park). This is a great location!

Close to both the green line and blue line.  2 blocks from Oak Park, IL.  Street Parking is available. You can get down town in 20-30 minutes.
transit: Close to both the green line and blue line.  2 blocks from Oak Park, IL.  Street Parking is available. You can get to down town Chicago in 20-30 minutes and down town Oak Park in less than 10 minutes.

This is a large 2br/2ba unit surrounded by windows and the hum of city life. Eat-in chefs kitchen, modern comfortable furnishings, and unit sleeps 6 (two on an air bed). Excellent choice for those looking to see the city in style!  30-day min please

Windows everywhere! For those who like to take it all in and people watch!

All building amenities are yours, including pool, gym, grills etc.

Text me and I'll text you right back!

Everything is right outside your door, or within 1-2 blocks.  Literally everything.

Yes brown line is 1 block and busses on Kinzie as well

I'll shoot you wifi and check-in instructions as soon as booking is confirmed.

access: Kitchen, Living room, family room and laundry room
description:
Modern home with open style kitchen and living room space. All appliances are available for use. Cozy, clean place with lots of natural light! We have two bedrooms available to share, one with double bed and other is queen size bed. We have parking space available. We are friendly and are open to conversations if you would like!

We care for cleanliness for us and for others.  Please do not walk with shoes inside the house, slippers will be provided for indoor use.

Kitchen, Living room, family room and laundry room

We are flexible with check-in upto 10:30 pm at night.

We are very close (0.8 miles- 15 minute walk or 2 minutes in Lyft/Uber) to the express Metra train station that takes you to downtown Chicago in 35 minutes! 5 minute walk (0.2 miles) to coffee shop!

access: The whole house is accessible to the guests.
description:
This is our home in the Chicagoland area. Welcome to our home. I would gladly rent to you. There are 4 bedrooms and a full basement, 2 1/2 baths. Our home is only 10 minutes from O'Hare Airport, there is a public transportation a block away, 15 minutes from Woodfield Mall, 10 minutes away from train going to downtown Chicago, very close to Rosement, Casino, Allstate Arena, and Rosemont Covention Center. Good restaurants, grocery stores and churches nearby. This will also be your home in Chicago.

The place is a home and can be home away from home while vacationing in Chicago area. This is a temporary home if you will be working in the Chicago area.

The whole house is accessible to the guests.

Very quite neighborhood and owners have lived there for a long time.

There is public transportation a few blocks from the home

This could be a home away from home during your vacation or if you are coming to Chicago for work.

access: There is a door at the bottom of the stairs that is the entrance to your 3rd floor private suite.  You would enter the house through a shared entrance.
description:
Welcome to a deluxe private suite on the 3rd Floor of our home.  Includes double bed, private bathroom, 2 dressers, closet, mini-fridge, microwave,  coffee maker, breakfast bars, wifi /cable TV, & FREE PARKING.   Perfect for a graduate student or business traveler.   A 5-10 minute walk to the train, a short train ride to downtown Chicago.   Easy transport to Chicago's medical district (Rush & UIC).  Close to art shops, restaurants, cafes.    Laundry available.  20% discount for monthly stays.

This is a quiet sanctuary to relax after a long day and enjoy the natural light coming through the windows.

There is a door at the bottom of the stairs that is the entrance to your 3rd floor private suite.  You would enter the house through a shared entrance.

Guests will enjoy privacy in a hotel-like suite that includes a mini-fridge, coffee maker, microwave, cable TV, and WIFI.   We are also available if you have any questions.

Welcome to the Harrison Arts District of Oak Park.  Your Airbnb is located on a peaceful,   tree-lined street .  You are a block and a half from the Oak Park Arts District which includes restaurants, small galleries, and  unique shops.

The blue line train is 3 blocks away and a 15-20  minute ride to downtown Chicago.  The Eisenhower (290) expressway is 3 blocks away.  Depending on traffic, it is a 10-30 minute drive to downtown Chicago.  A fenced in parking pad is available for overnight parking .  During the day, there is ample street parking.

description:
Cozy And cheerful apartment. Located very close to 18th Street in Pilsen and all of the restaurants/attractions it has to offer. Very close to public transportation that take you directly into downtown Chicago. You will love it.

Space is located on a quiet tree lined street in the historic neighborhood. Very close to great restaurants and shopping.

I am on the road quite a lot, but from time to time hope to mingle and make new friends.

This neighborhood is absolutely charmed and so is the space. It has all the magic you'd hope for and then some. You have shops and restaurants galore!

Public transportation is very easy. The space is located very closely to the 18th street bus that can take you downtown or to the nearest train stop. Uber is also very Pilsen friendly.

description:
Just 12.5 miles from downtown in the quiet Chicago neighborhood of Hegewisch.  Walking distance to the South Shore train line, which can easily get you to Chicago museums and entertainment, or take you to Indiana Dunes National Park or other attractions in NW Indiana.  Private parking in back also gives you the option of driving anywhere and then walking directly  to your door. Banks, restaurants, grocery, convenience, and liquor stores are all within 1 block of the apartment for all your needs.

HANDICAP ACCESSIBLE, with safety bars in bathroom if needed. 
Having all the conveniences of home, you will have access to full size refrigerator/freezer, stove, washer, dryer, and full bedroom sets in the apartment. Perfect for extended stays

Since I live in the house directly across from your building, I will be glad to help give advice as to what to see, attend to any questions you may have, etc. During the summer I am often gardening  in my yard, or sitting out by the fire on weekends. Even if I am at work or otherwise not available in person, I can always be reached by phone for any questions you may have.

Hegewisch is an extremely quiet, friendly neighborhood in the Southeast corner of the city of Chicago. Multiple Police, Firefighters, Teachers, and other professionals live in the neighborhood. There is a park a block away from where you will be staying, as well as churches of multiple denominations within walking distance

Besides having the convenience of the South Shore Train to get you quickly downtown or to Northwest Indiana shopping and attractions,  you can also take the Chicago Transit Authority bus, use your Uber or Lyft app to get a ride, or take any of the three expressways which all conveniently have entrance/exit ramps within a few miles from your location if you prefer to drive to your destinations, and then park feet from your door when you arrive back home.
house_rules:
After your booking has been confirmed I require a legal picture ID such as a drivers license or passport be shared within two days of your confirmation so I can have it on hand to confirm that the person checking in is the person that booked the apartment. This is done for the safety of both the guest and myself, as well as neighbors.

Gates to the yard must be kept closed at all times please.

description:
This bedroom is in my apartment in  the quiet Old Irving Park/Albany Park area in the Northwest of the city. You will have access to a full kitchen and laundry room as well as other common areas. We are 15 to 35 mins. to the beach and downtown and located a couple blocks away from CTA Brown and Blue train lines and buses and reasonable distance to Northeastern University, North Park University, Northwestern University, DePaul, UIC, Loyola U.
Since I am a retired woman I am accepting only women.

This bedroom has an excellent desk, desk lamp, comfortable chair, book shelf and a file cabinet for your own use. 
It also has a nice size dresser, closet, a body size mirror a night table and lamp. 
I'll provide good quality linens, pillows and towels if desired.

We will be only women  and no other persons are allowed to stay over. I am superhost and love helping my guests feeling comfortable in my home.

additional_house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 
 
1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 
6.) No deep frying or fire hazards.

access: You'll have full access to my entire two-story condo.
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

The best of both worlds! Recently renovated two-story condo in Old Town with all modern amenities,  in a classic 19th century Chicago home in one of the oldest parts of the city. Ideal for traveling families and friends, and plenty of Chicago culture nearby, from nearly every era. A neighborhood bar with Frank Sinatra's favorite ribs! Michelin-starred restaurants! And only 20 minutes to the Loop on the train - book today!

When you enter - via private entrance - you walk up a set of stairs into an open living room / dining room / kitchen with soaring ceilings. Down a hallway are two bedrooms: one with a King-sized bed and an en-suite bathroom, and one with a Queen-sized bed. There's another full bathroom along the hallway as well, and the washer and dryer. Up a set of stairs from the living room is an additional bedroom with a Twin-sized bed. The couch in the living room functions as another Twin-sized bed.

You'll have full access to my entire two-story condo.

An incredibly popular neighborhood destination, largely because of its close proximity to the lake and downtown, Old Town keeps up a lively pace day and night. Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.

I'm a 5 minute walk to the Sedgwick Brown line stop, and just as close to the North Ave and Halsted bus lines - it's easy to get around town without a car from here! There's street parking in the neighborhood if you'll have a car with you, however.

I do NOT allow parties of any type.
house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 
 
1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property. 
6.) No deep frying or fire hazards.

access: A key-less entry does not require my attendance at check in or check out, but I am in the area when needed.
description:
This newly remodeled home with 9 bedrooms, 9 queen beds, and 3 bathrooms is the perfect spot to gather  friends and family. Our space is clean, comfortable, and stylish. This corner of the neighborhood is quiet but Wrigleyville is full of great food, lively bars, and fun activities. Everything you need for your getaway is here. We have one dedicated parking spot available and plenty of permits for street parking!.

Our home has 3 common areas, 2 full kitchens, 2 dining rooms, a porch on the top floor, backyard, and one dedicated parking spot.

A key-less entry does not require my attendance at check in or check out, but I am in the area when needed.

If you love brunch, there are plenty of great spots. Try out the Kit Kat Lounge or El Mariachi for their bottomless mimosas. Lowcountry and Old Crow are great for Chicago BBQ, while John Barleycorn has the best burgers! Feel free to reach out for more recommendations

The famous Wrigley Field is a 10 minute walk away. The nearest CTA stop is the Sheridan Red Line, which can take you or transfer you throughout the city.
