access:
-Unit Access is through the front of the property.

-Guests will access their unit through a private entrance. Instructions will be given 3 days prior to stay.
description:
Welcome to Chicago! 

Our Charming 2bed/1bath unit is perfect for both leisure & business travelers.

We are conveniently located between O'hare & Downtown in the very safe Jefferson Park Neighborhood and short distance to Jefferson Park Transit Center (Trains) & Highways.

-Professionally designed space with modern furniture. 

-The entire unit is for your own use. 

-50" Flat Screen TV in the living room with Unlimited Netflix streaming.

-Brand new Whirlpool stainless steel appliances in the kitchen, including Refridgerator, Microwave, & Stove/Oven Range.

-Sleep in a comfortable Gel Infused Queen Size beds in the bedrooms, and the living room sofa converts into a sofa bed.

-Basic Dinnerware, Cutlery, Drinking Glasses, and Pots & Pans provide.

-We provide towels, toilet paper, and shampoo for your use.

-We have shared coin laundry on premise. You may use it at your convenience. Detergent is not provided by host.

-Unit Access is through the front of the property.

-Guests will access their unit through a private entrance. Instructions will be given 3 days prior to stay.

We are available by phone throughout your stay. You can simply call or text if you have any questions.

Our condo is a 30-minute drive northwest of Downtown Chicago, conveniently situated to give you a nice balance between exciting city life and relaxed suburban vibes. It’s close enough to the city for weekday commutes yet far enough to give you space to relax after a long week. And with a grocery store right across the street, you will always be minutes away from food or any other necessities you may need throughout your stay. 

If you enjoy cooking, we have a Jewel-Osco grocery store right across the street. They sell fresh produce, countless snacks, and have a fantastic beer, wine, and spirits collection. So if you’re craving an afternoon libation but don’t want to venture far, you’re in luck!

Within half a mile you will find two local restaurants where you can enjoy a meal with locals. The first is the Gale Street Inn Chicago. This neighborhood rib joint has been serving signature ribs in a friendly atmosphere since 1963. And if you can’t make their 3pm-5:45pm happy hour, no need to worry, the happiness continues from 9pm-11pm at the bar.

Another local favorite is Galvin's Public House. This family-owned Irish pub loves serving up pints, showing sports games, and entertaining guests with their live DJ nights. They have daily drink and food specials, so be sure to check their website for an updated listing. Oh, and did we mention they have a fireplace in the dining room?

Craving some international cuisine? Pho No.1 Vietnamese Cuisine is right around the corner from Galvin’s. Pho No. 1 is where you can grab a quick, healthy bite and be in and out in no time. They have a variety of healthy options and are known for their large portions and fast service.

Jefferson Park is a 6 min walk from our place and is a nice little spot to relax on the weekends. Grab a picnic lunch and enjoy reading a book while you soak up some sunshine. You might also be lucky enough to stumble upon their Sunday farmer’s market. Roberts Square Park is just under a mile but worth the trip. The park’s lush green grass makes it perfect for people watching or getting in a refreshing run.

Our place is a 12-minute drive from O’Hare International Airport and a short drive into Downtown Chicago.

Although we have a Jewel-Osco grocery store across the street and some restaurants nearby, we recommend either renting a car or taking rideshares (Uber or Lyft). Having access to a vehicle, whether your own or a rideshare, will most definitely make your stay more enjoyable. Within a 10-minute ride from our place, you will have access to a variety of different restaurants and public parks. And the Kennedy Expressway (I-90/94) is only 3 minutes away.

If you’re going to be making weekly trips into Downtown and looking for convenience, driving will take anywhere from 45 minutes to 90 minutes depending on traffic. Although we offer free parking in a garage, taking the train into Downtown might be your best bet. From our place, it’s a nice 10-minute walk to Jefferson Park Station, then a 30-minute ride into the city.

-There is street parking on adjacent blocks on Giddings Street & Leland Avenue. Do not park on Central Avenue as there are several tow zones.

-NO Baths in the tub. Bathroom is meant for SHOWER use only.

-All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as we have other tenants at the property. 

-All guests must be mindful of walking hard or running in the unit, to not disturb the guests below.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.

-The owner of the building has 2 security cameras on the Exterior of the Building on the Front Court Yard and Back Yard.
house_rules:
Check-in time is 3PM - 12AM (midnight) Self check-in with keypad
Check out by 11AM 

*HOUSE RULES* 
Please read carefully to avoid any Cancellation of Reservation or fines

-No shoes. Please remove shoes upon arrival.
-No smoking. If you smoke inside the unit or property, we will cancel your reservation and we will fine you for $200 for damages.
-No Drugs (including Marijuana).
-Do not engage in any ILLEGAL activities anywhere on the property.
-No Parties or events, No outside visitors, and No overnight guests without previous approval from your host.
-Any approved additional overnight guests must pay the extra person fee outlined on our AirBnB profile.
-No pets, except Dogs & Cats are allowed.
-If you have pets an extra $50 dollar cleaning fee will be added to your reservation -Bathroom is meant for Shower Use Only.
-All food items should be stored in designated food areas and not left out, to avoid pests.
-Use kitchen freely but clean up any mess that is created, including dishes, counters, stove, microwave; no dirty dishes should be left in the sink overnight.
-If you break or damage something, please let me know and arrange for its replacement or repair.
-Some cleaning is required before you check out. Please ensure dishes are washed, furniture that is moved is put back, and trash is thrown out. The cleaning fee outlined in the profile is included to clean the place after your stay, however if you leave the place excessively dirty, with dirty dishes and garbage everywhere, that requires more cleaning, we may charge up to $100 additionally for the extra work incurred. -Quiet hours must be observed between 10pm-8am.
-Other things to note  -All guests need to be attentive to the house rules during their stay, as we have other tenants at the property.  -Neighbors have called and will call the police for any guests who do any illegal activities, including smoking Marijuana on the premise.
-We have STRICT rules against noise, music, and/or partying and have cancelled reservations due to complaints in the past.

The owner of the building has 2 security cameras on the Exterior of the building on the front court yard and back yard
interaction: We are available by phone throughout your stay. You can simply call or text if you have any questions.
neighborhood_overview:
Our condo is a 30-minute drive northwest of Downtown Chicago, conveniently situated to give you a nice balance between exciting city life and relaxed suburban vibes. It’s close enough to the city for weekday commutes yet far enough to give you space to relax after a long week. And with a grocery store right across the street, you will always be minutes away from food or any other necessities you may need throughout your stay. 

If you enjoy cooking, we have a Jewel-Osco grocery store right across the street. They sell fresh produce, countless snacks, and have a fantastic beer, wine, and spirits collection. So if you’re craving an afternoon libation but don’t want to venture far, you’re in luck!

Within half a mile you will find two local restaurants where you can enjoy a meal with locals. The first is the Gale Street Inn Chicago. This neighborhood rib joint has been serving signature ribs in a friendly atmosphere since 1963. And if you can’t make their 3pm-5:45pm happy hour, no need to worry, the happiness continues from 9pm-11pm at the bar.

Another local favorite is Galvin's Public House. This family-owned Irish pub loves serving up pints, showing sports games, and entertaining guests with their live DJ nights. They have daily drink and food specials, so be sure to check their website for an updated listing. Oh, and did we mention they have a fireplace in the dining room?

Craving some international cuisine? Pho No.1 Vietnamese Cuisine is right around the corner from Galvin’s. Pho No. 1 is where you can grab a quick, healthy bite and be in and out in no time. They have a variety of healthy options and are known for their large portions and fast service.

Jefferson Park is a 6 min walk from our place and is a nice little spot to relax on the weekends. Grab a picnic lunch and enjoy reading a book while you soak up some sunshine. You might also be lucky enough to stumble upon their Sunday farmer’s market. Roberts Square Park is just under a mile but worth the trip. The park’s lush green grass makes it perfect for people watching or getting in a refreshing run.

access: Guests also have use of the common area laundry room just off the rear door of the apartment.  Open small backyard space as well.
description:
Convenient location to explore the best that Chicago has to offer.  Just 2 blocks from the restaurants and nightlife of Wicker Park along Milwaukee Avenue.  Just a 3 minute walk to Blue Line train stop, then just a 10 minute train ride to downtown.  
Enjoy the city with this cozy 2BR garden unit apartment a your home base.

-ATTEN: This unit is located on the lowest level of the property. This is a basement/garden unit. UNIT B. Guests visiting will need to walk down 3 steps to enter the unit. 
- 2 Bedroom apartment, approximately 750 sq. ft.  The apartment works best for 4 or fewer guests but can accommodate up to 8 with queen size pull-out sofa bed as well as optional queen size air mattress.  In the 2 bedrooms - one bedroom has a queen bed, other has a full/double.  The dining table seats up to 4.
- For your comfort and protection bed mattresses and all pillows have hypoallergenic covers to control dust-mites and bed bugs.
- Pillows are top rated Snuggle-Pedic Ultra-Luxury Bamboo Shredded Memory Foam Pillow.
- Beds mattresses are Tuft & Needle Adaptive Foam, providing the comfort of memory foam but cooler and more supportive.
- Air mattress is SoundAsleep CloudNine Series Queen Air Mattress with Dual Smart Pump Technology.
- Keurig coffee maker with a variety of coffee and teas.  
- Brita water filter pitcher
-For A/C in the summer months, we provide 1 window unit in the living room and 1 in each bedroom - Every room also offers a ceiling fan. The unit stays typical cooler since its a basement unit. Very comfortable year round.

Guests also have use of the common area laundry room just off the rear door of the apartment.  Open small backyard space as well.

Resident and co-host Nathan is available to assist guests as needed.

Located at the intersection of the hot, hip neighborhoods of Logan Square, Bucktown, and Wicker Park, you are just 2 blocks away from all the restaurants and nightlife on Milwaukee Avenue.

- Parking - street parking in the area is free.  Usually an open street parking spot can be found within a block of the property.
- Blue Line train (Western stop) is just 3 minute walk.  10 minute train ride to downtown, or 30 minute train ride to O'hare airport
- Divvy bike rental station just 400 ft away at Western Ave and Winnebago.
- Reasonable street parking in the area.
- From O'Hare airport, a 30 minute Blue line train ride takes you to the Western train stop 400 ft from the property.  Very convenient.
- From Midway airport, the Orange line train takes you into downtown, where you switch to Blue line to the get off at the Western stop and walk 400ft to property.  Total 1 hour trip by train, or take 35 min Uber ride (depending on traffic)
- Union Station downtown is accessible by Blue line.  Total trip is 26 minutes including the walk between Union Station and Blue line.

Luggage can be stored before or after your stay in the common area laundry/mechanical room.  Although the location is in a locked space, other building residents have access to this common area, so we cannot be responsible for it, it is at your own risk.

- Absolutely no parties - co-host lives in unit above and will not tolerate excessive noise or unregistered visitors.  Police will be called if needed.

access: Guests will have access to the entire private apartment, plus our yard.
description:
Welcome to this charming, sun-filled garden apartment in hip Logan Square. Walk to nearby bars and restaurants, grocery stores, the 606 trail, coffee shops and beautiful parks. Come stay with us and enjoy all that Logan Square has to offer!

Garden unit with funky, urban appeal.  Slightly lower ceilings (about 7 1/2 feet), but you'll barely notice as it has a very spacious feel and FANTASTIC bright, natural light throughout the day.  We have a fully-stocked game shelf and a bookshelf with tons of great reads, plus a TV with Chromecast so you can watch shows from your Netflix/Amazon/Hulu/YouTube etc.  There is a very comfortable queen-sized bed, a futon couch, and a lovely chaise lounge (not pictured) for lounging.  Two bar stool chairs and a small dining table or sit at the kitchen bar to eat.  We have a fully-stocked kitchen with stove, refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker and plenty of pots and pans and cooking utensils, and you will have access to our grill for BBQing.  Feel free to relax in our yard - we have a deck with a large table and chairs and plenty of places to sit among the garden boxes boasting fresh veggies all summer long!

Guests will have access to the entire private apartment, plus our yard.

We are available by phone, text and email at any time.

We love our quiet, residential corner of Logan Square, especially because there are so many restaurants, bars, and shops within walking distance! Some of our favorites just within a few blocks are: Wyler Road (great craft beer and gourmet sandwiches), Weegees (speakeasy bar, with a shuffleboard table and outdoor garden), Ground Control (the BEST vegan/vegetarian food ever), Best Intentions (hip yet laid-back bar with a great cocktails, hip snacks, and a huge beer garden), Rico Fresh taqueria (small neighborhood taqueria tucked inside one of the grocery stores within walking distance - the huevos rancheros for breakfast are amazing if you can handle spicy!), Damn Fine Coffee (local roaster, great coffee and pastries), L'Patron tacos (there are no words to describe how much we love this place - unique, delicious tacos, etc), and so, so, so much more! Two great grocery stores within walking distance (Tony's and Rico Fresh), and tons more restaurants, bars, and one-of-a-kind shops just a 20 minute walk or 7 minute drive to the heart of Logan Square. If you need restaurant recommendations, just ask! We know lots of great places and can cater to whatever you're in the mood for. Also be sure to take a stroll through beautiful Palmer Square park. There's a 1/2 mile walking/jogging path and lots of shady trees to sit beneath and watch the city go by.

Easy street parking if you're bringing a car.  If you're taking public transportation here is a city bus route 1.5 blocks away and we are a short 7 minute car ride from the 'L' train (Logan Square blue line stop).
interaction: We are available by phone, text and email at any time.
neighborhood_overview: We love our quiet, residential corner of Logan Square, especially because there are so many restaurants, bars, and shops within walking distance! Some of our favorites just within a few blocks are: Wyler Road (great craft beer and gourmet sandwiches), Weegees (speakeasy bar, with a shuffleboard table and outdoor garden), Ground Control (the BEST vegan/vegetarian food ever), Best Intentions (hip yet laid-back bar with a great cocktails, hip snacks, and a huge beer garden), Rico Fresh taqueria (small neighborhood taqueria tucked inside one of the grocery stores within walking distance - the huevos rancheros for breakfast are amazing if you can handle spicy!), Damn Fine Coffee (local roaster, great coffee and pastries), L'Patron tacos (there are no words to describe how much we love this place - unique, delicious tacos, etc), and so, so, so much more! Two great grocery stores within walking distance (Tony's and Rico Fresh), and tons more restaurants, bars, and one-of-a-kind shops just a 20 minute walk or 7 minute drive to the heart of Logan Square. If you need restaurant recommendations, just ask! We know lots of great places and can cater to whatever you're in the mood for. Also be sure to take a stroll through beautiful Palmer Square park. There's a 1/2 mile walking/jogging path and lots of shady trees to sit beneath and watch the city go by.
space: Garden unit with funky, urban appeal.  Slightly lower ceilings (about 7 1/2 feet), but you'll barely notice as it has a very spacious feel and FANTASTIC bright, natural light throughout the day.  We have a fully-stocked game shelf and a bookshelf with tons of great reads, plus a TV with Chromecast so you can watch shows from your Netflix/Amazon/Hulu/YouTube etc.  There is a very comfortable queen-sized bed, a futon couch, and a lovely chaise lounge (not pictured) for lounging.  Two bar stool chairs and a small dining table or sit at the kitchen bar to eat.  We have a fully-stocked kitchen with stove, refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker and plenty of pots and pans and cooking utensils, and you will have access to our grill for BBQing.  Feel free to relax in our yard - we have a deck with a large table and chairs and plenty of places to sit among the garden boxes boasting fresh veggies all summer long!
summary: Welcome to this charming, sun-filled garden apartment in hip Logan Square. Walk to nearby bars and restaurants, grocery stores, the 606 trail, coffee shops and beautiful parks. Come stay with us and enjoy all that Logan Square has to offer!
transit: Easy street parking if you're bringing a car.  If you're taking public transportation here is a city bus route 1.5 blocks away and we are a short 7 minute car ride from the 'L' train (Logan Square blue line stop).

additional_house_rules:
1. Prohibited: Video Shooting, bring people that is not in the reservation, Small gatherings, family reunions, birthdays parties or any kind of celebrations. 
2. No smoke inside the house or building (any kind) 
3. Respect other Airbnb guests, belongings, food and other rooms.
4. Be quiet in the house and in the building specially after 9pm. 
5. Checkout from your room is by 10am and our checkout is firm becase our team schedule. Checkout from your room after this time will end in extra 30$. Checkout after 11am will end in extra 60$. Checkout after 12pm will end in an open  file in airbnb plus 60$ fee (2 hours paid for management team) and your belongings would have to be removed since another guest will be checking in.
6. If you use the kitchen, microwave, oven, plates, pans, pots, glasses, cups, kitchen table, living room table, coffee maker, fridge, etc.. you have to leave it clean
7. After use the shower / bathtub clean the hairs you left. Take your own amenities with you. Don’t leave it in the bathroom.
8. Booking for somebody else is not allowed unless agreed before booking.
9. If you damage or lost any key the fee is 45$. 
10. We will send you missing items if you want but it will be 40$ plus shipping.

Ps: keys and missing items fees are: 20$ hourly rate management plus 20$ Uber (go and return) plus the key or the shipping)

access: You can use the kitchen, oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! Also three bathrooms, living room, hair dryer, iron, and the pool table! You will have WiFi, clean towels, sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.
description:
This place is Located on west loop, which is actually considered Part of Downtown (has a Train station very close(7min walking/0.3miles). This train works 24/7. It goes to the heart of Downtown and also direct to the airportO’hare. My place is only 16 minutes(public transportation) to the heart of Downtown. 8-12min driving( 2.5miles). If you want to go to United Center this place is  10 min far by walk but we have one place even closer that is right in front! Please read the whole advertisement!

You will have a comfortable full Size Bed in a private room! You don’t need to worried about keys becase to get in the house you use a keypad and to get in your room you’ll have a small combination lock! 


There is free parking on the street but if you want to have a private spot in a private indoor garage you you could ask me if it is available for 12$ per night. 

*I only accept payments through Airbnb platform*

You can use the kitchen, oven, pan, pots, plates, coffee maker, etc! Also three bathrooms, living room, hair dryer, iron, and the pool table! You will have WiFi, clean towels, sheets, comforter, Shampoo (2in1), hand’s soap, body’s soap, toilet paper.

If you text me I will be there for you most of the time I’ll try to give you quick responses! If you are a tourist I will love to tell you about some places you can’t miss!

The best point about this place is how close It’s to Downtown (15 min-public transportation, 10 min-car) If you going to a Event at United Center it’s so close as well( 10 min walking). The location it’s perfect to those who goes to an interview/ research/ work at Rush Medical Center, Cook County Hospital, John H Stroger, Jr.

This room is downstairs (basement) and the ceiling is not too high (if you are over 6ft you may be uncomfortable) but this room has more privacy than others!

The room is private but you will share common areas (pool table, kitchen , living room, and the 3 bathrooms ) with other Airbnb guests. Usually none of this get crowd becase most of Airbnb people are most of the time outside the house knowing the city, in concerts, interviews, etc, and they don’t spend much time in the house. A private apartment in the area usually cost over 120$ p/night plus taxes and fees which is in total almost 200$ p/night ! If you want save some money and being close to downtown, surrounding great public transportation and with free street parking this could be a great option for you! 

The room has a good size for the full size bed it has. If you want to add 3 or 4 people in the reservation you can use the twins beds but then the room will become extremely small for luggage becase you will have three beds on it. This is a good option if you want to save even more money otherwise you can book two rooms!

access:
The entire apartment space and gym available at the building. 
You will find washer and dryer also at the building.
description:
Rise and shine like a boss in a HUGE bed right in the heart of Chicago! Besides the utmost comfort, there’s also a BIG SCREEN TV with NETFLIX we placed for you to unwind after a long day. Building is in a great location, only steps from Millennium Park, Mag Mile, Riverwalk, Cloud Gate and more! You will also always be connected with our PORTABLE WI-FI that you can carry around! Many restaurants, bars, stores and shoppings surround the area for your convenience. Have an unforgettable stay!

For sleeping there is one King size bed, another extra bed that you can request if need one. There's a closet where you can put your clothes easily.
*Unit offer pillows, blankets and bed linens.
We have a beautifully space designed with sleek and modern finishes, fast Wi-Fi service, big TV, fully kitchen (with modern equipment and kitchen utensils), and all the bathroom amenities for you take long baths and relax during your stay.

The entire apartment space and gym available at the building. 
You will find washer and dryer also at the building.

Feel free to call or send a message anytime.
Always happy to recommend local breakfast, good restaurant, coffee shop, etc. We are here to help you with your needs.

Our time for check-in is from 3:00 p.m to midnight, but if you arrive early or have a late departing flight, please just ask and I will do my best to accommodate you time.  Check-out at 11:00 a.m.

additional_house_rules:
- As you are our guests, we want you to feel welcome in our home at all times.  Feel free to use bathroom and kitchen items, but if you use it completely, please replace.  This is a smoke free home but smoking can be done outside and used cigarettes can be disposed of carefully in back garbage bin.  No pets please. We ask is that you treat our home as well as you would your own and leave it as you find it.  Please come, relax and enjoy your stay!
- Prefer to limit shoes in the home.  Parties not encouraged but small gatherings welcome.

access: Guests will have access to the top 2 levels of our 3 level home via a lockbox on our front door.  The code should be changed and the box closed after every use for security purposes.  Would be best to keep keys in the lockbox when leaving the home to avoid loss.  Please note, the first level (ground) is occupied by other AirbNb guests so please be mindful of noise levels (running/heavy walking, loud music).  Perhaps you can compare adventures!
description:
WELCOME!  Our home is designed to appeal to prospective guests looking for modern amenities, cleanliness and comfort during the summer months.  It is located in a friendly & safe neighborhood with great restaurants & boutiques nearby which can be traveled to by foot, Uber/taxi or public trans.  Lake/beach/park/Wrigleyfield close by.  Street parking very easy and free.  Have a wedding, family reunion or simply a larger group looking for some Chicago fun??  This home is where memories are shared!

This is a vintage home with modern amenities while still maintaining some of the original charm.  Our home sits on an extra wide lot making the home bigger than the average old Chicago "cottage".  Being that it is a late 19th century Chicago home, the original floorplan had all bedrooms on the main living level which has now been converted for better function for a modern family.  There are now 3 bedrooms, including a large mastersuite, on the upper level and 1 on the main level which serves as a multi-purpose room, including a guest room with 2 single beds when needed.  There is ample room/seating for 6 - 8 guests who can spread out in the 4 common areas.  Additionally, guests are welcome to use the outdoor space which brings added comfort and is good for outdoor dining, relaxing or small gatherings.  We invite you to take advantage of the grill, firepit and garden.

Guests will have access to the top 2 levels of our 3 level home via a lockbox on our front door.  The code should be changed and the box closed after every use for security purposes.  Would be best to keep keys in the lockbox when leaving the home to avoid loss.  Please note, the first level (ground) is occupied by other AirbNb guests so please be mindful of noise levels (running/heavy walking, loud music).  Perhaps you can compare adventures!

Whether we are present or not, we are always happy to provide info on our home and give guidance on places to visit in Chicago to make your stay more memorable and fun.  We have neighbors and friends who are around to help us maintain our 5 star hosting status so please let us know if you are need of any additional assistance on the premises or simply need to learn more about what is in area.

We love our home, but we want you to love it, too!  What makes our home particularly unique is our immediate neighborhood and neighbors.  Despite living in a 'big" city, many children safely play outside all along our block.  While you may not encounter them often, neighbors are out walking (dogs) and are accessible and friendly.  They will be a great resource if we are not available.  We also have a lovely park about 4 blocks away which has 2 tennis courts, track, walking paths and playlot.  Beach, Wrigleyfield, Magnificent Mile all within 10-20 minutes of our home pending traffic/time of travel!

If you do not have a car, there is public transportation in walking distance The local bus can be caught a block away and the EL train is approx 6-7 blocks way.  UBER is also a means of transport.   If you do have a car, there is usually plenty of street parking accessible in the front of our home.

Grocery stores, gyms, local restaurants, bars and cafes anywhere from .5 mile to 1.2 miles (10-12 blocks) away.  We are located near a big park where there are 2 tennis courts and a track. We are only 1.5 miles from Lake Michigan where large beaches and bike paths are a great way to pass the time.  If you are seeking downtown adventures, our home is only 15 minutes driving via Lake Shore Drive to Michigan Ave's famous Mag Mile, John Hancock, Rush Street, Gold Coast, river, museums, theater, etc.  Your fun is limitless here!
house_rules:
- As you are our guests, we want you to feel welcome in our home at all times.  Feel free to use bathroom and kitchen items, but if you use it completely, please replace.  This is a smoke free home but smoking can be done outside and used cigarettes can be disposed of carefully in back garbage bin.  No pets please. We ask is that you treat our home as well as you would your own and leave it as you find it.  Please come, relax and enjoy your stay!
- Prefer to limit shoes in the home.  Parties not encouraged but small gatherings welcome.

description:
Stylish room with full bed in greystone building located two blocks from the Logan Square Blue Line Station. The building is also within walking distance from the Logan Theatre, Palmer Square Park, Logan Square Monument, Logan Square’s thriving nightlife, and many great restaurants. You are welcome to use the living, dining, and kitchen area. Bathroom and common areas are shared with the host. There is wifi, heat, and A/C.

You will find that the apartment is mostly decorated with mid-century modern furniture. I also have unique artwork and several plants to give the place additional character.

With input from you about your preferences, I am happy to offer suggestions about things to do and places to eat in the area.

Logan Square is a trendy neighborhood located on the Northwest side of the city. The area is characterized by the prominent historical boulevards, stately greystones and large bungalow-style homes. Logan Square is just three CTA stops from Wicker Park. You can also access Chicago's downtown (also called the Loop) via a 20 minute subway ride.

The Logan Square Blue Line CTA Station is two blocks away. There are also several bus routes nearby. If driving, the 90/94 interstate off ramp is about a 5 minute drive from the apartment. Street parking is available.

access: A lockbox has been set up so guests can feel free to come at their leisure anytime after the 3p check-in. You'll have access to the entire apartment and there’s free street parking.
description:
This place has it all- marble & hardwood floors, a massive kitchen with full amenities, 3 flat screen TVs, king size Sealy Black mattress with a second bedroom, and the living room can sleep AT LEAST 2 additional people on top of each couch.

Third floor modern 1300sq apartment with full amenities and late check-out. There are 2 air-conditioners located centrally throughout the unit along with ceiling fans which keeps the place cool. Once inside, you will find everything that you need and feel right at home.

A lockbox has been set up so guests can feel free to come at their leisure anytime after the 3p check-in. You'll have access to the entire apartment and there’s free street parking.

I’m usually not present for every check-in, but at some point I will come up and introduce myself and welcome you aboard.  However, I’m always available to answer questions and address comments.

Historic Bronzeville where homes date back to the 1800s, known for high ceilings and large space. Up and coming area, the properties are well-maintained and conveniently located near everything in the City whether you travel by bus, train, Uber or your own vehicle, it is but a short distance away.

Within walking distance, about .5 - 4 blocks to public transportation, 10mins to beautiful downtown Chicago, 10mins to Soldier Field, 10mins to United Center, 10mins from US Cellular Field, President Obama's house 5 minutes away, Museum of Science and Industry 10mins, Shedd Aquarium 10mins, Ms. Biscuit 3mins, Chicago Chicken & Waffles 10mins, Harold Washington Cultural Center 6mins, Chinatown 6mins, and much more.

1. TVs are RoKu equipped!
2. You can sleep on top of the two couches in the living room (both sofa beds are inoperable). 
3. The $1,000.00 security only applies if you damage or steal anything during your stay. Even then, it’s up to that amount after the claim is filed. Your card does not get debited period (not prior to and not after if no claims are filed).

Towels should only be used for bathing, DO NOT USE THEM OTHERWISE!!

Only number of guests on reservation are allowed in the unit!

access: You are welcome to use all the shared areas of the apartment, open the French doors onto the living room and read a book on the sofa in the sunshine, eat or work in the dining room, cook and make coffee in the kitchen, take your morning coffee and newspaper to the back porch.
description:
You'll love it! Elegant vintage apartment with high ceilings and filled with sunlight. Walking distance to the CTA Brown Line Damen stop, nearby parks, and Lincoln Square cafés and shopping. Close to Wrigley Field. Very safe neighborhood. LGBTQ and POC welcome. Happy to communicate in English, Italian, Spanish, German and French. I look forward to hosting you.

You are welcome to use all the shared areas of the apartment, open the French doors onto the living room and read a book on the sofa in the sunshine, eat or work in the dining room, cook and make coffee in the kitchen, take your morning coffee and newspaper to the back porch.

I am available to help with suggestions about what to do, where to go, and how to get there in this wonderful city of Chicago. I love to eat so I have a lot of recommendations for best restaurants in the neighborhood and in the whole city.

Hands down one of the best neighborhoods in the city, combining quiet residential streets and charming districts with cafes, restaurants, shopping and parks.

Easily accessible via Uber, public transport and easy street parking.

Light sleepers: the nearby train can be heard from the bedroom, though the AC drowns out most of its sound. In fall and winter with closed windows, it is not noticeable. Personally I find the train sound soothing. 
3rd floor apartment with no elevator. It's a good workout!
house_rules: Please do not move furniture or the artwork.

additional_house_rules:
Our unit is the garden unit of our home so we do live upstairs. We do have an alarm system for the home which  is attached to the basement windows. Hence you will see signs on the windows that you will not be able to open the garden unit windows or alarm will go off. We have central air and heat so should temperature be a problem we can fix that for you. 

We also have a bidet in our guest bathroom that is only to be used and operated by adults, if desired, to make sure it’s is turned off completely and not left on. Our treadmill gym is only to be used by adults not children. If you want to use it to work out we will give you the power key. Access to cable TV and Netflix. Ordering movies on demand prohibited due to charge. 

We do have a laundry room that both guests and hosts can use listed under the shared spaces. Should you need to use the laundry machines you will need to provide your own detergent and let us know so we are aware and don’t impede on your laundry time with our own.

You will get a key to the back gate to enter your private unit and use to lock gate always upon entering and exiting. This gate must be locked ALWAYS. To enter your unit we will give you a key code to use for the door to open and lock it. This code is not to be given to anyone else but staying guests. The unit is not intended for parties or outside company ONLY for booking guests. Our unit is intended for three guests max unless it’s a fourth child than you can message us with further questions. 

Lastly we have lovely back patio furniture  that you can use and sit outside on to enjoy the sun. We just ask that you clean up after your hangout. The grill is not for use for guests. We also want to reiterate we are a non smoking property.

access: Guests can use backyard Patio to hangout outside. Guests can use laundry room and all areas in guest garden suite. We have one full size bed in bedroom, the reclining leather couch in the living room area that can be slept on, and a twin size air mattress that blows up incredibly high that we have sheets, pillow, and blankets for. Guests are allowed to use all these to lay their heads for some sleep.
description:
A wonderful garden unit suite in the heart of Hermosa Chicago Neighborhood. We are two blocks from popular Chicago bus route Fullerton and a 10 minute drive from Chicago’s L train blue line Logan square, which goes downtown. We are a 10 minute drive  down Fullerton Street from Chicago Metra Line that goes out to the suburbs. Our location is in the middle of 3 transportation routes making it easy to get around the city. 2 blocks from shopping stores and restaurants. Free street parking everywhere

Our neighborhood is hip and upcoming with a family orientated flavor. Our space is good for couples, solo travelers, friends traveling, and families with children above 2. It has everything you need for your stay to feel at home and comfortable.

Guests can use backyard Patio to hangout outside. Guests can use laundry room and all areas in guest garden suite. We have one full size bed in bedroom, the reclining leather couch in the living room area that can be slept on, and a twin size air mattress that blows up incredibly high that we have sheets, pillow, and blankets for. Guests are allowed to use all these to lay their heads for some sleep.

We are available for any issues or concerns via telephone. We will give you cell numbers once you arrive.

Our place is close to lots of restaurants and shopping stores. We also are located  about 5 minutes next to neighborhood Logan square which is very trendy, young, and hip where there are lots of bars and coffee shops.

Guests can easily use three transportation vehicles such as train, bus, or Metra. Driving in our area is very easy and parking is free and not limited at all in our neighborhood.

Non-smoking property.

access: The entire apartment.
description:
A private bedroom in a two bedroom apartment located in Chicago's Marshall Square/Pilsen/Douglas Park neighborhood.

The apartment was completely renovated during the past year and is located on the first floor of a three story century old vintage brick building, locally known as a three flat. Redone in the style of a "soft loft" the unit has 10 foot ceilings, spiral duct work, newly refinished hardwood maple floors and an exposed brick wall in the kitchen. This bedroom is one of two in the apartment and has a queen size bed and a large walk in closet. The apartment is shared- at a maximum - with one other person. Each guest has their own bedroom. Each bedroom door has a keyed lock.

The entire apartment.

I am always available by text, email or phone.

Marshall Square, adjacent to the better known Pilsen area, was settled and built largely by Czechs in the later part of the 19th  and early 20th century. Buildings are almost exclusively brick with attractive facades and are separated by narrow "gangways". While not one of Chicago's trendier areas, transportation links into the Loop are excellent, with a train station at the end of the block and less than a 20 minute ride to the Loop. The neighborhood is predominately Mexican now, with many excellent and inexpensive restaurants. Laguinitas Brewery and Pub is just a few blocks away as is Cinespace Movie Studio, where several network and cable tv shows are filmed.

Less than a block from the California Pink Line station. From their the West Loop is about a 15 minute ride and the Loop about a twenty minute ride.

Thank you for your interest in our place. Friendly cat with no claws, lives with us as well as 3 years old child. Will try to help with all I can. Feel free to reach me at any time.

additional_house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.

access: You'll have full access to the entire loft, plus the apartment's dedicated bathroom and building's laundry room.
description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 28+ at 35% off! 

A renovated and professionally decorated loft in a building dating to the 1880s in Old Town is exactly where you want to stay during your trip to Chicago - the location is ideal for seeing everything you've got on your list: across the street from Second City, Steppenwolf, and Lincoln Park, and about 20 minutes' train ride from the Loop or Wrigley Field.

The loft's bathroom isn't shared, but it is a few steps down the hall. Also, one of the beds in my place is a top bunk - up a step ladder.

You'll have full access to the entire loft, plus the apartment's dedicated bathroom and building's laundry room.

An incredibly popular neighborhood destination, largely because of its proximity to the lake and downtown, Old Town keeps up a lively pace day and night. Victorian-era buildings, brick alleyways and narrow, tree-lined streets are charming backdrops to a busy main strip that runs along Wells Street between North Avenue and Division Street.

My place is a few minutes' walk away from the Sedgwick Brown/Purple line train station, and equally convenient to the North Ave and LaSalle buses - it's almost more convenient to not have a car here! If you do bring your car, however, there are several garages nearby with overnight parking.
house_rules:
- House Rules: Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.  

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable. 
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property.

description:
Beautiful top floor house with private rooftop deck! Rooftop bar and grill, private room with TV and bathroom, and best of all Louie the Frenchie pup! Located right in the heart of Bucktown, this neighborhood will give you the real Chicago home experience. 

Short 10min walk to the CTA blue line which will take you downtown to the loop. Guests can use my Midtown Athletic Club wristband to use their swimming pools and workout facilities.

Private bed/bath, kitchen and living room and rooftop deck are available for use

Lockbox key access

Always available via Airbnb messages or phone, will reply quickly!

description:
Come relax in this stylish 2BR/2BA, professionally managed by Kasa. In the middle of all Chicago has to offer - near large companies and a short distance to Grant Park and delicious local restaurants, bars, and shopping. Less than 2mi to McCormick Place. 
Key features include: 
*Relax in the luxurious king-sized bed 
*Cook and enjoy wonderful cuisine with the modern high-end kitchen 
*Browse the web and stream HD video with ultra high-speed internet 
*Work out in the upscale fitness center

House Rules: 
We created Kasa to be your home on the road.  We’re committed to being great neighbors and strictly enforce these House Rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. NO Smoking - Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property. This applies to the entire apartment (including the balcony or patio), as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. Noise - At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment. In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9:00 p.m. to 8:00 a.m.  Parties and large gatherings are prohibited.  Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy.   Occupancy – Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit. There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted.  Lost and Found - Kasa assumes no liability for lost, misplaced, stolen, or damaged belongings, including any belongings which are left in the unit after your departure time has passed.  Pets –With the exception of service animals, breed and pet restrictions are imposed by the building management. Requests to bring a pet must be approved by Kasa prior to booking. $15 Daily pet fee per day will apply. Pet fees are not included in the total reservation price. If you are authorized to bring a pet, an additional pet fee will be applied after the booking is complete. Kasa has a 1 pet per apartment limit.  Return of Fobs & Keys – All designated fobs, keys, and parking passes must be left in the apartment upon check out.  Failure to do so will result in an immediate replacement fee of up to $250.00 per item. Please alert Kasa staff immediately if any items are missing at the beginning of your stay.   Infestation - If Kasa determines that you have brought any infestation into the unit or onto the premises, Kasa reserves the right to charge you for any and all costs and expenses that Kasa deems necessary to address the infestation.  Parking at Own Risk - All vehicles parked on the premises must be registered with Kasa prior to arrival. Vehicles are parked at the risk of the owner. Kasa shall not assume liability or responsibility for any vehicle, occupants, or contents while operated or parked on the property.  Damaged or Missing Property - Guests are liable for any damage and/or theft at the unit, premises, or property caused by the guest, their visitors, or other persons present in the unit during the guest’s stay. This includes damage to rooms, fixtures, furnishings and equipment (such as towels, artwork, electronics, and kitchen equipment). Kasa reserves the right to charge guests for 120% of such amounts as it shall in its sole discretion deem necessary to compensate or make good the costs or expenses incurred or suffered by Kasa as a result of the damage and/or theft. Charges may include but are not limited to: all property damage; missing or damaged items; smoking fee; cleaning fee; and guest compensation.  Identity Verification - To protect against identity theft and fraud, and for the safety of other guests and neighbors in the community, you will be required to provide a scanned or photographed copy of your valid, government-issued photo ID during the virtual check-in process for the purpose of performing a background check or screening.  Use - The unit and amenity areas shall not be used for any unlawful or illegal purpose. No nails, screws, or other items may be driven into any portion of the unit. Guests shall use the unit for residential purposes only. Guests shall not conduct any commercial, industrial, or retail activity in the unit.  Client Accommodation Agreement - Prior to arrival, all guests must agree to abide by the Kasa Stay Rules, which will be provided to the guest for review and signature during the virtual check-in process. Security Deposit – Non-compliance with the House Rules and Kasa Stay Rules could result in a penalty and/or forfeiture of the Security Deposit and/or eviction without a refund.

notes:
House Rules: 
We created Kasa to be your home on the road.  We’re committed to being great neighbors and strictly enforce these House Rules to ensure the comfort and safety of our community. NO Smoking - Smoking of any kind (including tobacco, marijuana, e-cigarettes, vape pens, and hookahs) is never allowed at this property. This applies to the entire apartment (including the balcony or patio), as well as all common and outdoor areas of the building. Kasa apartments may be monitored with marijuana and tobacco sensors. Noise - At all times, Kasa guests may not disturb their neighbors’ quiet enjoyment. In addition, guests must observe quiet hours from 9:00 p.m. to 8:00 a.m.  Parties and large gatherings are prohibited.  Kasa apartments are proactively monitored with decibel sensors for compliance with this noise policy.   Occupancy – Each Kasa has a maximum occupancy limit. There can be no more than the specified number of guests on the premises at any given time. Large gatherings are not permitted.  Lost and Found - Kasa assumes no liability for lost, misplaced, stolen, or damaged belongings, including any belongings which are left in the unit after your departure time has passed.  Pets –With the exception of service animals, breed and pet restrictions are imposed by the building management. Requests to bring a pet must be approved by Kasa prior to booking. $15 Daily pet fee per day will apply. Pet fees are not included in the total reservation price. If you are authorized to bring a pet, an additional pet fee will be applied after the booking is complete. Kasa has a 1 pet per apartment limit.  Return of Fobs & Keys – All designated fobs, keys, and parking passes must be left in the apartment upon check out.  Failure to do so will result in an immediate replacement fee of up to $250.00 per item. Please alert Kasa staff immediately if any items are missing at the beginning of your stay.   Infestation - If Kasa determines that you have brought any infestation into the unit or onto the premises, Kasa reserves the right to charge you for any and all costs and expenses that Kasa deems necessary to address the infestation.  Parking at Own Risk - All vehicles parked on the premises must be registered with Kasa prior to arrival. Vehicles are parked at the risk of the owner. Kasa shall not assume liability or responsibility for any vehicle, occupants, or contents while operated or parked on the property. Use - The unit and amenity areas shall not be used for any unlawful or illegal purpose. No nails, screws, or other items may be driven into any portion of the unit. Guests shall use the unit for residential purposes only. Guests shall not conduct any commercial, industrial, or retail activity in the unit.  Client Accommodation Agreement - Prior to arrival, all guests must agree to abide by the Kasa Stay Rules, which will be provided to the guest for review and signature during the virtual check-in process. Security Deposit – Non-compliance with the House Rules and Kasa Stay Rules could result in a penalty and/or forfeiture of the Security Deposit and/or eviction without a refund.
summary:
Come relax in this stylish 2BR/2BA, professionally managed by Kasa. In the middle of all Chicago has to offer - near large companies and a short distance to Grant Park and delicious local restaurants, bars, and shopping. Less than 2mi to McCormick Place. 
Key features include: 
*Relax in the luxurious king-sized bed 
*Cook and enjoy wonderful cuisine with the modern high-end kitchen 
*Browse the web and stream HD video with ultra high-speed internet 
*Work out in the upscale fitness center

description:
Very clean private room in the heart of Chicago with 2 single-sized beds for 2 travelers who wish to sleep separately. LATE check-out (2 pm!) and FREE PARKING! You will have your own door code and may arrive as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed!

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like.

The neighborhood is extremely QUIET & SAFE

Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 5 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)

The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door. 

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like

> LATE check-out! Stay/sleep in your room until 2 pm!

> Apartment is NEWLY renovated and PROFESSIONALLY designed by an interior designer

> 2 single-sized beds with GREEN TEA & ALOE memory foam mattresses

> 5 MIN to DOWNTOWN

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance 

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO 

> 5 MIN walk to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago)

> 15 MIN walk to Rush University & Hospital

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation.  I will also be providing a folder full of recommendations, places to eat and nightlife from the local, it will be on your bed upon arrival :)

100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.

"Racine" blue line is the closest blue line train (metro) station, only 3 minutes away (walking). 
-Downtown/Loop: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and get off at "LaSalle, Jackson, or Monroe," depending on where you are going :) FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 5 minutes to downtown.
-O'Hare Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare. O'Hare is the final stop. FROM - take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 40 minutes to O’Hare.
-Midway Airport: TO - take blue line towards O'Hare and transfer to orange line at "Clark/Lake," then take orange line to towards Midway airport. Midway is the final stop! FROM - take orange line towards Adams/Wabash; then, transfer to blue line at "Clark/Lake." Take blue line towards Forest Park and get off at "Racine" About 45 minutes to Midway.
-Union Station/Amtrak: Only 20 minutes away (walking), taxi or uber will take you to the apartment in less than 5 minutes for about $6 :)

description:
Private loft-style room in the heart of Chicago with a PRIVATE ENTRANCE, FREE parking, and a GREEN TEA & ALOE memory foam mattress. You will have your own door code and may arrive as late as you wish, EASY self check-in guaranteed. 

I allow LUGGAGE DROP OFF! You can store your luggage in the closet before check-in and after check-out times, you can drop it off and pick it up as early and as late as you would like. 

The neighborhood is extremely safe, even at night :)

Restaurants and bars are right round the corner, both upscale and casual. This room is 5 minutes away by car or uber to Chicago's famous Willis (Sears) tower. Uber costs about $7. If you are arriving by car, I am providing free resident parking passes for anywhere in the area. (Yes, that means you can drive a few blocks and still park anywhere you want!)

The room will be ONLY yours for the time you'll stay in my Windy City. You will have a key to lock the door. 

> PRIVATE entrance

> Free parking provided: park BEFORE your check-in and stay parked AFTER your check-out if you would like

> Apartment is NEWLY renovated and PROFESSIONALLY designed by an interior designer

> Mattress is GREEN TEA & ALOE memory foam mattress

> Can host up to 3 people (air mattress for 3rd person)

> Fireplace (but for decoration only, please)

> 5 MIN to DOWNTOWN 

> Restaurants and bars are 5 MIN away walking distance 

> 5 MIN walk to PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION/METRO 

> 3 MIN walk to UIC (University of Illinois at Chicago) 

> No security deposit

> Cancel up to 24 hours in advance to get a full refund

> Last minute reservations are welcome!

You will be given a door code to access the apartment and a key to lock your private room. You may arrive as late as you would like with my code entry. You may store your luggage in the closet BEFORE and AFTER check in so you don't have to haul your bags around the city. You will be able to view your check-in instructions under "House Manual" as soon as you confirm the booking. The door code will be sent to you 1 night prior to your arrival, or immediately if you have a last-minute reservation. I will also be providing a binder full of local recommendations to eat, go out and enjoy Chicago's nightlife- you will find the binder on the bed in your room!

100% of guests love my location- it is the best of both worlds: 5 minutes from the very center of downtown, yet quiet enough to not hear the noise at night. If you are still not convinced, please read my reviews.

The closest public transportation BLUE LINE is UIC HALSTED and is a 3 minute walk. It takes you to Willis Tower, Millenium Park and almost every other tourist destination in under 10 minutes!

Please no overstaying past your checkout time

additional_house_rules:
BANGTEL Welcomes You and Your Group

EARLY CHECK-IN / LATE CHECK-OUT
May be possible pending availability. Rates are as follows:
1-3 hours of standard check-in/check-out time $50
3+ hours subject to a half day rate or standard $125

CHECK-OUT TIME
Check-out time is prompt at 11 AM.  We would love to let you stay forever, but the issue is we have someone checking in right after you.  If you have not been approved for a late check-out, you will be subject to a $50 fine each 15 minute interval that you delay the Cleaning Team.  We value our Cleaner's Team time and work and hope you do as well.  A delayed checkout only causes stress and extra work for them.   We hope you understand, so please make sure to check out on time in order to avoid any fine.  If a late checkout time is mandatory, please make sure to make arrangements upon booking.  We will do our best to accommodate your request pending availability.  

SECURITY 
Must provide copy of photo ID upon booking via the message center or via email to stay@bangtel.com  
PHOTOSHOOTS/FILMS
If you are booking for a Photoshoot or Production, we have special rates for you and all shoots must be approved prior to booking.  

PARTIES / EVENTS
Additional refundable security deposit will be taken for parties and events.  

Additional fees apply for any guests over the maximum allowed number of guests on the listing.  Parties and event fees are based on a case by case basis, number of guests, and duration of the event. 

PARTY GLITTER & CONFETTI FEE
Those small little shiny fun circles are not fun at all for our cleaning team to pick up.  They are actually a nightmare for the clean-up team and we politely warn you that there will be an additional fee for sprinkling glitter or confetti.  Please note, you are more than welcome to wear that lovely sequined jumpsuit, by all means bring it to the party. ;-)

SHOES
No matter how fabulous your shoes are we do ask that you PLEASE remove them when in the house.

FLOORING
PLEASE only use the Rubio Monocoat to clean or wipe the floors on the third floor.  The cleaner is clearly labeled and located in a spray bottle under the kitchen sink. 
 
NO SMOKING PLEASE
There is absolutely no smoking allowed in the unit.  You are welcome to smoke outside, but please dispose in the provided ashtrays. There is a $500 fine for smoking in the unit.

PETS
Can be allowed with approval prior to your stay and costs $125 pet fee per pet.  A portion of the pet fee goes to support The Hit Living Foundation, a charity that supports animal and human welfare.  

CHECKOUT INSTRUCTIONS / CLEANUP
Please clean up and discard all your trash prior to your departure.  
Please also shut and lock all doors and windows. 

EVERYDAY IS EARTH DAY 
We kindly ask that you turn the lights out daily when you leave for the day during your stay, turn the air con up or heat down, and recycle.  If you are cranking the air con, by all means enjoy, but please make sure the windows are closed.   
We have large recycle bins for your use and directives on the refrigerators, so you can see what is recyclable.

access: You have access to the entire two apartments, private back wooden porch spaces, and parking for one SUV or two small compact vehicles (when parked one behind the other).
description:
Take over this original Historic remodeled palatial two-story Brownstone in the heart of Lincoln Park, Chicago.  Located right on the infamous Clark Street across from the Lincoln Park Zoo and just steps to Lake Michigan, there will be no complaints about the central location of BANGTEL's Mr. Clark's Family.  Stay with everyone, family and friends, all under one very spacious roof giving you privacy and intimacy when you require it.  This modern, sunlit space will have your group feeling good.

Double the fun with two living areas and two kitchens.  Need a little privacy from your mother-in-law, nanny, or a loud "Snorer" in the group?  Book this combination for the best feeling of spaciousness and privacy.

You have access to the entire two apartments, private back wooden porch spaces, and parking for one SUV or two small compact vehicles (when parked one behind the other).

We encourage you to text, call, or message us on the Airbnb app with any issues or questions.

The neighborhood could not be more conveniently located.  This location in Lincoln Park is next to Lake Michigan and the Lincoln Park Zoo, award winning restaurants, and great local bars.  Mr. Clark's is just a short walk to the Magnificent Mile as well for the infamous shopping and eating of Chicago.  To get to Chicago's Loop or McCormick Place Convention Center, it is a 15 minute drive or taxi.

Download the Uber or Lyft app for swift pick-up or drop-off needs. 
Parking is onsite for one large size SUV or vehicle.  Two compact cars may fit one behind the other (tandem style) behind the unit. We recommend the Spot Hero app for parking for additional spaces in the area.

access: Guests are welcome to use the backyard of the property, including the fire pit and the terrace.
description:
Spacious & open-concept apartment in the heart of Oak Park, IL. BRAND NEW construction within a home built in 1902 provides sparkling clean amenities and Victorian charm.  Includes a full kitchen with brand-new appliances, two bedrooms, and a full bathroom. Guests will have access to WiFi and a TV with streaming capabilities. 

Property is an annex of a larger home on a cul-de-sac street in the Historic District. Guests have shared use of the backyard patio.

PREMIUM location in the epicenter of Oak Park - historic home to Prairie School architect Frank Lloyd Wright and author Ernest Hemingway.  25-minute train ride to Millenium Park, Soldier Field and the Magnificent Mile. Ample and convenient street parking in front of the property.

Guests are welcome to use the backyard of the property, including the fire pit and the terrace.

I live in the townhome above the apartment so I am fequently home to help.  I do work a lot, so please text, email, or call if you need anything.

Guests will receive one set of fresh towels and linens per visit.

Property is a five-minute walk from downtown Oak Park, which is home to a host of lovely bars and restaurants. The property is also a short walk to the historic Hemingway and Frank Lloyd Wright districts. The property is on a tree-lined street full of Victorian homes.

Driving around the neighborhood is easy as there is little traffic. The apartment is also within walking distance of the Green and Blue train lines, which can take guests to Chicago in minutes.

Parties are subject to a safety deposit  and owner's permission. Check in is after 3:00pm and check out is before 11:00, but we will accommodate special requests when possible. No smoking anywhere on the premises please, including the yard.
house_rules: Parties or events allowed only with additional cleaning fee and permission from the host prior to booking. Please contact the host  before booking for any parties or events. No smoking anywhere on the premises please, including the yard. Groups must have at least one person 25+ years of age.

access: During your stay please enjoy our cozy Basement apartment with 2 private bedrooms and 3 futons in the living room. Bedrooms each have 3 drawer dresser, 2 drawer nightstand, lamp, chair and wall mounted TV with Streaming service.  Also available in the apartment, our full equipped kitchen, bathroom, living room with TV Streaming service. Kitchen has Coffee and tea, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, refrigerator, Stove oven, cups, glasses, pots, pans, cooking utensils, plates and silver ware (please wash all utensils after using them). Laundry room on the premises with washer/dryer machine.
description:
Northwest Chicago Basement 2 bedroom apartment coneveniently Located 20 minutes away from Wrigley Ville, 20 minutes away from Down Town & 30 min from O'hare! Sleeps 2-8 people, perfect for large groups traveling on a budget! Access to CTA Belmont Bus and many local restaurants and stores! Get to know the City of Chicago with an authentic home-style experience!!

Chicago northwest side 2 bedroom basement apartment

During your stay please enjoy our cozy Basement apartment with 2 private bedrooms and 3 futons in the living room. Bedrooms each have 3 drawer dresser, 2 drawer nightstand, lamp, chair and wall mounted TV with Streaming service.  Also available in the apartment, our full equipped kitchen, bathroom, living room with TV Streaming service. Kitchen has Coffee and tea, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, refrigerator, Stove oven, cups, glasses, pots, pans, cooking utensils, plates and silver ware (please wash all utensils after using them). Laundry room on the premises with washer/dryer machine.

Thank you for booking with us! We look forward to hosting you. Please feel free to reach out to me through out your stay by messaging or by phone if you have any questions or concerns. And some rules to know about our home: Only people included in the agreed booking, rental reservations are aloud on the premises and within the apartment. We do not allow loud gatherings or parties on the premises. If you bring any other people into the apartment you will be charged an extra fee per person. No Smoking allowed on the premises. Any guests breaking these rules will be asked to leave.

Safe northwest chicago city residential area close to public transportation, restaurants and stores within walking distance.

Accessible to Chicago CTA Belmont bus, Uber or Lyft.

Our Cozy 2 bedroom basement apartment is within a brick 2 flat home on Chicago's Northwest side residential neighborhood. Please Note: Permit street parking only. The side streets are okay to park.  Clean trash bags have been placed in the cabinet underneath the kitchen sink. Please dispose of full trash bags and replace with a clean one. The trash will be pickup once a week from the bins located in the alley behind the rear of the building.

access:
Guests have access to the bathroom, kitchen, living and dinning room.

Feel free to use the stove, microwave and fridge.  I also have coffee and tea.

Wifi will be provided; There is tv in the room and living room.
description:
This private room has a comfortable full bed,  closet, dresser and tv. The room is small, it is great for one or two persons (please look at the pictures and be sure you want to book for two guests, since the bed is against the wall).  

The apartment is located in a nice and calm neighborhood (Noble Square/West Town). You will find bars, restaurants, nail salons/spa and grocery stores in a walking distance. 

Downtown 15 to 20 minutes on bus or train. O'hare 45 to 1 hour on blue line train.

The apartment is cozy and clean. Living room, dinning and kitchen are in an open area. 

What I loved most about the apartment is the natural light that comes through the windows.  Bedrooms are a little darker though.

Guests have access to the bathroom, kitchen, living and dinning room.

Feel free to use the stove, microwave and fridge.  I also have coffee and tea.

Wifi will be provided; There is tv in the room and living room.

Guests can reach me through Whatsapp or Airbnb messenger

Eckhart park has an indoor pool, you can swim for free when open pool is scheduled. There are bars, restaurants and shopping stores on Bucktown, West town and Wicker Park.

Division and Chicago blue line is 10 minutes walk, really convenient for international travelers. Also Chicago and Milwaukee bus stop are roughly 3 minutes walk and both can take you downtown in 15 to 20 minutes.

During winter time:
I put plastic on the windows to protect from cold wind. 
Heater system make some noise when is warming up but it won't last for so long.

access: Keyless entry.  The space is a completely separate apartment.  You will have your own private access to come and go from the space as you wish.
description:
Large but cozy apartment in an 1895 farmhouse surrounded by the adorable Andersonville neighborhood of Chicago.  Located just 2 miles from Wrigley Field and 1 mile from the Lake Front!  Newly remodeled with all the best fixtures and just two blocks away from vibrant Clark Street with lots of coffee shops, great restaurants, and adorable boutiques & antique stores.  There is plenty of free street parking and we are surrounded by public transportation options.  *Only accepting guests with reviews*

Completely remodeled apartment.

Keyless entry.  The space is a completely separate apartment.  You will have your own private access to come and go from the space as you wish.

We live upstairs in our own separate apartment.  We can have as much or as little interaction with you as you would like.  Someone should be available at all times should you need assistance.

Andersonville was originally developed by Swiss immigrants.  In the 80s and 90s a population of gay and lesbian artists entered the area and the artistry remains today.   Lots of galleries and boutiques to walk to and be sure to visit The Women and Children First Bookstore!   Some of the best chefs in downtown open their second location right here on Clarke St.  But you can still enjoy good, cheap eats at Pauline's Diner just two blocks away, which has been serving food to local residents for decades!

Free parking is available on our street for those who may be renting a car.   In good weather, there are bus and train options within minutes walk of the house to take you anywhere in the city.   There are plenty of Lyft and Uber options nearly any time of day or night as well.

**We are only accepting guests that have been reviewed by other hosts.**  Please do not request to stay with us if you are brand new to AirBnB and do not yet have any reviews from other hosts.  Unfortunately we have been burned in the past and now we use this review system to confirm that guests are who they say they are.  Sorry for the inconvenience.

access:
During your stay, you will have full access to the entire unit.

While I'm sure you will want to venture out to try all the great eateries in Chicago, we also accommodate home cooking.

Feel free to use our kitchen! We provide pots, pans, cutting board and kitchen utensils during your stay. There also is a microwave, oven and a coffee machine. Please take care of our equipment just as if it were your own and clean them well. We have some basics like oil, salt and pepper for seasoning, however if you want to get fancy and need those extra spices, there is a supermarket nearby.
description:
Come stay at our newly built three bedroom apartment! Conveniently located, it's minutes walk away from the Halsted Orange line, a short local drive to popular places such as McCormick Place and Soldier Field, and directly across from Palmisano Park.

The apartment complex offers food options on the ground floor for your convenience and location is right by Chicago's Chinatown that offers great late night options.

We look forward to hosting all!

Hardwood floors throughout, the apartment is a great for larger families or groups. We have 3 bedrooms offering 4 beds in total (2 queens and 2 twins) as well as a sofa that pulls out for some additional sleeping space.

Comfort is our priority and we have memory foam mattresses for all our beds

Wifi is provided and we just installed a brand new 55'' 4K SmartTV!

There are two full restrooms, one with a shower and the other a tub/shower.

The sheets and towels, as expected will be fresh. 
We also provide shampoo, conditioner and body wash as well as a fresh clean set of hand towels.

We also have the extra perks of an outdoor deck next to the living room. During your stay, you are welcome to sit outside on the deck, just be sure to lock the door when you come back in.

There are two points of entry to my unit, however the main access will be from the rear of the building where there is one exclusive parking space during your stay to park at.

During your stay, you will have full access to the entire unit.

While I'm sure you will want to venture out to try all the great eateries in Chicago, we also accommodate home cooking.

Feel free to use our kitchen! We provide pots, pans, cutting board and kitchen utensils during your stay. There also is a microwave, oven and a coffee machine. Please take care of our equipment just as if it were your own and clean them well. We have some basics like oil, salt and pepper for seasoning, however if you want to get fancy and need those extra spices, there is a supermarket nearby.

This is completely upon the guests preference! I will be there when you need me through text and e-mail and I am happy to give you any help necessary for recommendations.

Some important house rules and items to note during the stay:

- WiFi will be provided during your stay

- We ask that everyone take shoes off and place them at the entry

- The complex has many families that live here, there are strict quiet hours from 10pm-7am

- Absolutely no parties

- Parking: There is one spot exclusive to the unit at the rear of the building (We will provide a picture prior to check-in of the spot). It is important that you ONLY park at this spot and that you display the green parking permit (provided inside living room upon check-in) when parked at all times. Should you park at any other location not designated for our unit, your car may be towed at your cost. If you have additional cars, you may park them on the street overnight (just be sure to read the signs).

- Unfortunately our complex does not have an elevator. The unit is on the second floor which makes it the easiest unit to access via stairs

- We do not allow pets

- Cleaning fee will be $80 per stay

- Any lost keys, lockout, or keys not returned will incur a $500 charge. If parking permit is not returned, guest to pay additional $200 fee to replace.

- For any noise complaints and if police are called, or if guests smoke in the unit, there will be a $300 fee
