access:
Guests will need to walk down the driveway to the back of the property and enter through a door between the garages. Take the flight of stairs up to the coach house door. 
We will have a lockbox on the door and will give guests the code, prior to their arrival.
There is a parking spot outside the garage for one car.
description:
This cozy coach house, nicknamed Linden Place
is on the grounds of an Historic 1909 Prairie-Style House in Oak Park. Nestled among the trees you will find a quiet studio apartment with a private entrance, full kitchen, sitting room, and bath. There is a sleeper sofa for an extra guest.  Let us know if you would like to enjoy the fire pit or use the charcoal grill.

Built in 1925, this coach house was originally the quarters for the chauffeur and cook for the main house. There was an intercom system at the bottom of the stairs to communicate with the owner, Mr. Cronwall.
We renovated the space in 2011 for our own guests and now have expanded to Airbnb. There is a very efficient Fujitsu split system for heating and cooling that uses a remote control. A Keurig coffee maker is on hand for that first cup of Joe before you head out for the day.

Guests will need to walk down the driveway to the back of the property and enter through a door between the garages. Take the flight of stairs up to the coach house door. 
We will have a lockbox on the door and will give guests the code, prior to their arrival.
There is a parking spot outside the garage for one car.

This is a seperate building with its own entrance. We are  often available when guests arrive and love meeting new people and hearing of your traveling adventures. We are happy to offer advice on things to do and see in Oak Park/Chicago.

Located in the Frank Lloyd Wright Historic District you will find stunning architectural treasures all around you.  You will be close to shopping and many restaurants, including Hemingway's Bistro and of course, the Frank Lloyd Wright Home and Studio.

One off street parking space will be available for our guests. The house is located within walking distance of the Green Line to downtown Chicago as well as the Metra Station. 
A quick Uber ride will get you into Chicago for endless entertainment possibilities. There are bike rentals available in town and several guided tours.

additional_house_rules:
• Please don’t eat or wear shoes in the bedrooms. I hate fines, but eating, wearing shoes, or doing anything in the bedroom that results in the carpet having stains of any kind will result in a minimum $100 fine. 

• There’s a back porch if you want to smoke anything — including cigarettes. 

• Most of my neighbors are working people with families, so try to keep noise to somewhat of a minimum. You don’t have to be mute, just be mindful of them. 

• Also, regarding neighbors... they generally mind their business, but if they happen to ask you questions, please keep your responses to a minimum. :) 

• Enjoy your stay and don’t hesitate to ask me for any assistance you may need.

description:
This... is a great place to stay for a true Chicago experience!

This cozy, 2 bedroom apartment is fully stocked with everything you need to make yourself at home! Living and dining area feature a sectional and dining room table for relaxing or getting work done. Bedrooms feature pillow top king and queen mattresses for some of the best sleep of your life! I promise you this. I own the same mattresses. 

Regardless to the reason for your visit, this space is perfect for whatever you‘re here for!

The entire unit, including a reasonable portion of the back porch, are available for you to use.

I live in the neighborhood and I love it! I totally don’t mind hanging out or socializing, but I also completely respect your privacy. I can be as involved as you do or don’t want me to be, but generally, I’ll leave you alone unless you need something or ask me specifically to be involved with your stay.

The location is one of the central features of this property! Depending on how comfortable you are with urban scenery, you can walk, but a car is suggested. The unit is centrally located between two main Chicago expressways — I-94 (the Dan Ryan) and Lake Shore Drive. In addition, you are well within walking distance to two Green Line stations, which makes getting to downtown in 20 minutes a breeze. There is a brand new full service grocery store (complete with liquor section) that’s a 2 minute drive, 7 minute walk located nearby. University of Chicago/UCHICAGO Medicine campus is a 10-12 minute walk, 4 minute drive. President Obama’s Chicago home is a 10 minute drive. The beach is a 5 minute drive. 

While I truly believe that the central location here is one of the best features of the unit... and while I love and live comfortably in this neighborhood, I don’t want to mislead anyone who is not super comfortable with urban living. If you’re not from or have familiarity with a major urban city, you might be in for a little bit or a culture shock.

I would definitely SUGGEST a car, but you absolutely do NOT need one. You can easily move about the city within a 10-30 minute window by walking, taking the bus, or taking the train from this location.
